STRATEGY FOR ARMY TACTICAL WHEELED VEHICLE PROGRAM 10 USC 7013 note. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3F33FD6AA183496EA4322CB101671D96" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Strategy required Time periods.

In the budget justification materials submitted in support of the budget of the Department of Defense (as submitted with the budget of the President under section 1105(a) of title 31, United States Code) for each of fiscal years 2025, 2030, and 2035, the Secretary of the Army shall include a report on the strategy of the Army for tactical wheeled vehicles. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDD470F6ED8064327AF167A5ADB18F542" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Requirements for strategy Each strategy required by subsection (a) shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8BBD896CACD64EFCA854CE1B3A7B876D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) align with the applicable national defense strategy under section 113(g) of title 10, United States Code, and applicable policies; 10 USC prec. 971.

MULTIYEAR PROCUREMENT AUTHORITY FOR VIRGINIA CLASS SUBMARINE PROGRAM <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0CA73C65C3A54883AD0714EB31392AA6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Authority for multiyear procurement Subject to section 3501 of title 10, United States Code, the Secretary of the Navy may enter into one or more multiyear contracts for the procurement of not more than 13 Virginia class submarines. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H95E999F29D2E494CBA3D6212C96064FB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Authority 137 STAT. 328 for advance procurement Effective date.

328 for advance procurement Effective date. The Secretary of the Navy may enter into one or more contracts, beginning in 137 STAT. 170 fiscal year 2024, for advance procurement associated with the Virginia class submarines for which authorization to enter into a multiyear procurement contract is provided under subsection (a) and for equipment or subsystems associated with the Virginia class submarine program, including procurement of— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H35C40D94D37344FC95651D228499238B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) long lead time material; or <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6F1CC0B07B624ACE8810597A682BA6F1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) material or equipment in economic order quantities when cost savings are achievable.

LIMITATION ON CONSIDERATION OF GOVERNMENT-OPERATED DRY DOCKS IN CERTAIN CONTRACT SOLICITATIONS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCC591F1E8348451F90B3C651718851BB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general California. With respect to a solicitation of the Secretary of the Navy for the award of a contract for private sector non-nuclear surface ship maintenance in San Diego, California, the 137 STAT. 171 Secretary shall ensure, in accordance with section 2466 of title 10, United States Code, that Government-operated dry docks are only included in such solicitation if there is insufficient capacity at privately-operated dry docks for performance of such contract.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H537D0FD42BBC4BD09EC15D20D750C81B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Repeal Section 142 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2016 (Public Law 114–92; 129 Stat. 755) is amended— 131 Stat. 1639.

PROCUREMENT AUTHORITY FOR OVER-THE-HORIZON RADAR SYSTEMS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD725F3B0A7FD41BBA59FD00E32139BE4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general As soon as practicable after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of the Air Force shall seek to enter into one or more contracts for the procurement of up to six over-the-horizon radar systems that meet the requirements of the United States Northern Command with respect to the detection of increasingly complex threats. 137 STAT. 175 <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5A2447BC5720433C91B7AE5C63F65787" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Use of competitive procedures and sole-source contracts <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3520AA0DEA9D4623A5A7E52165AE802B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Initial contracts With respect to the award of a contract for the procurement of the first two over-the-horizon radar systems under subsection (a)— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H565DB5B16F554A9BACF9BCDD2B9B562F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the Secretary of the Air Force may use procedures other than competitive procedures (in accordance with section 3204 of title 10, United States Code) if the Secretary determines it is not feasible to use competitive procedures; and Determination.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB2214A22062049F59AE6B1B154B83DBD" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 141. LIMITATION ON ISSUANCE OF ACQUISITION STRATEGY FOR THE KC–135 RECAPITALIZATION PROGRAM The Secretary of the Air Force may not issue an acquisition strategy for the KC–135 recapitalization program until the date on which the Secretary submits to the congressional defense committees the following documentation: 137 STAT. 176 <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H93E46E5854444F24B36C67C1D8EC68F3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) An updated tanker roadmap timeline to include procurement of the Next Generation Air Refueling System.

The limitation under subsection (a) shall not apply to individual F–16C/D aircraft that the Secretary of the Air Force determines, on a case-by-case basis, to be no longer mission capable and uneconomical to repair because of aircraft accidents, mishaps, or excessive material degradation and non-airworthiness status of certain aircraft. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1DA59BB6176A4EB6B813179AC4B0B746" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Information to Congress For each F–16C/D aircraft that the Secretary of the Air Force proposes to retire in a fiscal year, the Secretary shall include, in the materials submitted by the Secretary in support of the budget of the President for that 137 STAT. 177 fiscal year (as submitted to Congress under section 1105(a) of title 31, United States Code), a description of— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDFA4D12FBD6E46B5A5677D7B70ECA5FB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) each upgrade and modification made to such aircraft, including— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC1610D54233E45F1AAE9AE9F2DD8E905" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the date of the upgrade or modification; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA5B24638B2F649E7AA49B170FA71407A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the cost of such upgrade or modification in current year dollars; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H33A4CEE857634669A52D66B1097031B2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the estimated remaining service-life (expressed as equivalent flight hours and years) of— Estimate.

The Secretary of the Air Force may not take any action described in subsection (b) until the date on which the Secretary certifies to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and the House of Representatives that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1220CBFB39BD4A74882F0233702EB609" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the Secretary has identified a solution to fix the remote vision systems of KC–46A aircraft; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H023DE6EA31EF4FD8B1EE2005F9B21D2F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) such solution resolves all issues identified in the category 1 deficiency reports for such systems, except for issues relating to the panoramic system. 10 USC prec. 20201.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H99DAD9276CCE4E8AADC77DFF93F7D431" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Actions described The actions described in this subsection are the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCE890546977F4FB892FD390AFC2BF4DF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Approving the incorporation of version 2.0 of the KC–46A remote vision system into production aircraft (other than an aircraft specifically used to test and validate that version of the system). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCEE7D42323044C138FB5F37DC7735001" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Retrofitting aircraft with version 2.0 of the KC–46A remote vision system (other than an aircraft specifically used to test and validate that version of the system 137 STAT. 178 ).

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H387CC72D3EBB41439D0F4E01DB58249A" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 148. PLAN FOR LONG-TERM AIR FORCE FIGHTER FORCE STRUCTURE 10 USC 148. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4F8BE3CDDBAB4C37B59F2FEEB43EE4B5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Plan required The Secretary of the Air Force, in consultation with the Director of the Air National Guard and the Commander of the Air Force Reserve, shall develop a long-term tactical fighter force structure, recapitalization, training, and sustainment plan for the active and reserve components of the Air Force.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5DBE4B86AD9746AB8EEB9A9637B0E1DF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) Any plans of the Secretary to augment or supplant existing piloted tactical fighter aircraft training events via acquisition and fielding of common, joint, all-domain, high-fidelity synthetic simulation environments. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H02F9A825BE2045BAA561539F9F50CD92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report Not later than April 1, 2024, the Secretary of the Air Force shall submit to the congressional defense committees a report that includes the plan developed under subsection (a 137 STAT. 179 ).

ANNUAL REPORT ON FORCE STRUCTURE CHANGES EXHIBIT FOR THE DEFENSE BUDGET Chapter 9 of title 10, United States Code, is amended by inserting after section 233 the following new section: 10 USC prec. 2271.

<quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H8280D4B58338407F9F0EDFB57F5C5DCC" style="OLC"> <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7C22DA12F6754CBA964734AB7903F134" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 233a. ANNUAL REPORT ON FORCE STRUCTURE CHANGES EXHIBIT FOR THE DEFENSE BUDGET 10 USC 233a. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H88E2B0BBE543424DBBADE798626F5593" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Annual report Not later than 10 days after the date on which the budget of the President for a fiscal year is submitted to Congress pursuant to section 1105 of title 31, the Secretary of Defense shall submit to the congressional defense committees a report on any major weapon systems proposed to be divested, re-prioritized, or retired in such budget.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3B096BBBF3494B73BCAA7E5B1C278F0A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Relationship to other reports The Secretary of Defense shall ensure that the report required under subsection (a) is deconflicted with the report required under section 222e of this title. 137 STAT. 180 <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3D967A7E42234DC699943187917C6CE4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Major weapon system defined In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">major weapon system has the meaning given that term in section 3455(f) of this title.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4402390301E74C1E98ABA671BDBBE4ED" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 152. MULTIYEAR PROCUREMENT AUTHORITY FOR DOMESTICALLY PROCESSED CRITICAL MINERALS 50 USC 98e-2. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEF380BC684B54B12A0EC49B407241D0D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Authority for multiyear procurement Subject to section 3501 of title 10, United States Code, and from amounts made available by discretionary appropriations Acts from the National Defense Stockpile Transaction Fund (as established under section 9(a) of the Strategic and Critical Materials Stock Piling Act (50 U.S.C.

MULTIYEAR PROCUREMENT AUTHORITY FOR DOMESTICALLY PROCESSED CRITICAL MINERALS 50 USC 98e-2. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEF380BC684B54B12A0EC49B407241D0D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Authority for multiyear procurement Subject to section 3501 of title 10, United States Code, and from amounts made available by discretionary appropriations Acts from the National Defense Stockpile Transaction Fund (as established under section 9(a) of the Strategic and Critical Materials Stock Piling Act (50 U.S.C. 98h(a))) after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Defense may enter into one or more multiyear contracts for the procurement of critical minerals that are processed in the United States by domestic sources.

98h(a))) after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Defense may enter into one or more multiyear contracts for the procurement of critical minerals that are processed in the United States by domestic sources. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE3421B6B0F624E21AAF2F2939FAF7F24" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Application of Strategic and Critical Materials Stock Piling Act A multiyear contract entered into under this section shall be deemed to be an acquisition under the Strategic and Critical Materials Stock Piling Act (50 U.S.C. 98 et seq .

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4B97D85B555744889FC0254CE41580BB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Condition for out-year contract payments A contract entered into under subsection (a) shall provide that any obligation of the United States to make a payment under the contract for a fiscal year after fiscal year 2024 is subject to the availability of appropriations or funds for that purpose for such later fiscal year. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC9662D25CC794DC0A980526686ABDDDE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Definitions In this section: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFB00AB8A331249D2AA818D19107F3B4B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">critical mineral means a mineral determined to be a strategic and critical material under section 3(a) of the Strategic and Critical Materials Stock Piling Act (50 U.S.C. 98b(a)).

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5347A98C9CE9490E9AAC71C0416F927D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">processed means the processing or recycling of a critical mineral or magnet, including the separation, reduction, metallization, alloying, milling, pressing, strip casting, and sintering of a critical mineral. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE6C7F8709A564A0FBEC1033B8C4A1978" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">domestic source has the meaning given that term in section 702 of the Defense Production Act of 1950 (50 U.S.C. 4552).

MODIFICATION OF REQUIREMENTS FOR MINIMUM NUMBER OF CARRIER AIR WINGS OF THE NAVY <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H78A8F8BED54F4038A3BB310271591F94" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Modification of requirements <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4E9C95B41FB94350A39DDBFAE483030B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Subsection (e) of section 8062 of title 10, United States Code, is amended to read as follows— <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HE9E147071C744211A3AA724DBC91FF86" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF788454C1A954E6CA2B6445B4E9A8054" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) The Secretary of the Navy shall ensure that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H32A02494D72B4618B456B21752442996" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the Navy maintains a minimum of 9 carrier air wings; and Definitions. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H54FFC599A5344470B53A3621C2762D90" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) for each such carrier air wing, the Navy maintains a dedicated and fully staffed headquarters.

MODIFICATION TO PROHIBITION ON CERTAIN REDUCTIONS TO B–1 BOMBER AIRCRAFT SQUADRONS Section 133 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2022 (Public Law 117–81; 135 Stat. 1574) is amended— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4F8BE4C9A5AA4041B8125E99B7EB7300" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) by amending subsection (b) to read as follows: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HCCC6751CB5D347629E7CAB537478E93F" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H10C87114AD614F8988810EF03853EF50" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Exceptions The prohibition under subsection (a) shall not apply— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H26A68481074342DC9CF32714A3E6A73B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) to a bomb wing for which the Secretary of the Air Force has commenced the process of replacing B–1 bomber aircraft with B–21 bomber aircraft; or <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H98CECE0DA2504DA2964B13B4B86A4180" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) so as to prohibit the retirement of the individual B–1 aircraft designated 85–0089, which has been determined by Secretary of the Air Force to be no longer mission capable and uneconomical to repair due to damage sustained on April 20, 2022. Determination.

PROHIBITION ON REDUCTION OF KC–135 AIRCRAFT IN PMAI OF THE RESERVE COMPONENTS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC0EBFFF0F2044091B8F40103071F1C24" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Prohibition None of the funds authorized to be appropriated by this Act or otherwise made available for fiscal year 2024 for the Air Force may be obligated or expended to reduce the number of KC–135 aircraft designated as primary mission aircraft inventory within the reserve components of the Air Force. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HACF5EED8F3684912AD00CB90B2533B8D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Primary mission aircraft inventory defined In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">primary mission aircraft inventory has the meaning given that term in section 9062(i)(2)(B) of title 10, United States Code.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H757ECB93781540FA8AA46E3930697FE6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Exception for plan Effective date. If the Secretary of the Air Force submits to the congressional defense committees a plan for maintaining readiness and ensuring there is no lapse in mission capabilities, the prohibition under subsection (a) shall not apply to actions taken to reduce the total aircraft inventory of E–3 aircraft to below 16, beginning 30 days after the date on which the plan is so submitted. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDEFBC2AD68714867AD2E9DAFFD604ABF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Exception for E–7 procurement If the Secretary of the Air Force procures enough E–7 Wedgetail aircraft to accomplish the required mission load, the prohibition under subsection (a) shall not apply to actions taken to reduce the total aircraft inventory of E–3 aircraft to below 16 after the date on which such E–7 Wedgetail aircraft are delivered.

If the Secretary of the Air Force submits to the congressional defense committees a plan for maintaining readiness and ensuring there is no lapse in mission capabilities, the prohibition under subsection (a) shall not apply to actions taken to reduce the total aircraft inventory of E–3 aircraft to below 16, beginning 30 days after the date on which the plan is so submitted. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDEFBC2AD68714867AD2E9DAFFD604ABF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Exception for E–7 procurement If the Secretary of the Air Force procures enough E–7 Wedgetail aircraft to accomplish the required mission load, the prohibition under subsection (a) shall not apply to actions taken to reduce the total aircraft inventory of E–3 aircraft to below 16 after the date on which such E–7 Wedgetail aircraft are delivered. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7047BE6E89FF438FAF154FE30352F276" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 143.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDEFBC2AD68714867AD2E9DAFFD604ABF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Exception for E–7 procurement If the Secretary of the Air Force procures enough E–7 Wedgetail aircraft to accomplish the required mission load, the prohibition under subsection (a) shall not apply to actions taken to reduce the total aircraft inventory of E–3 aircraft to below 16 after the date on which such E–7 Wedgetail aircraft are delivered. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7047BE6E89FF438FAF154FE30352F276" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 143. PROHIBITION ON AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS FOR TERMINATION OF PRODUCTION LINES FOR THE HH–60W AIRCRAFT None of the funds authorized to be appropriated by this Act or otherwise made available for fiscal year 2024 for the Air Force may be obligated or expended to terminate the operations of, or to prepare to terminate the operations of, a production line for HH–60W Combat Rescue Helicopters.

Analyses.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H88E2B0BBE543424DBBADE798626F5593" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Annual report Not later than 10 days after the date on which the budget of the President for a fiscal year is submitted to Congress pursuant to section 1105 of title 31, the Secretary of Defense shall submit to the congressional defense committees a report on any major weapon systems proposed to be divested, re-prioritized, or retired in such budget. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2000AA287A944338BDB4FEEA261BD785" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Contents Each report under subsection (a) shall include the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8C6D52D5D6F94C7383FBFB69B3226436" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Identification of each major weapon system the Secretary of Defense proposes to divest, re-prioritize, or retire in the period of five fiscal years following the date of the report. Time period.

Compliance. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H84765982E9CF4C71B195CD0CE1B3E74A" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 112. STRATEGY FOR ARMY TACTICAL WHEELED VEHICLE PROGRAM 10 USC 7013 note.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD17878DDD8CF48E6B1D16D04DAF5EFEB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Strategy elements Each strategy required by subsection (a) shall include the following: 137 STAT. 167 <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5445688E9C064083BE1D46715E049FBD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) A detailed program for the construction of light, medium, and heavy tactical wheeled vehicles for the Army over the period of five fiscal years following the date of the strategy. Time period.

Funding estimate. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF19D84FA87AE49F587485D0BF69017DC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) The estimated total cost of construction for each vehicle class used to determine the estimated levels of annual funding described in paragraph (3). Cost estimate.

Cost estimate. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2EF27F31FFFB4C1BB3D8E54B3A035788" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Considerations In developing each strategy required by subsection (a), the Secretary of the Army shall consider the following objectives and factors: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H606954935A0248D0BB6864FCBC472576" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Objectives relating to protection, fleet operations, mission command, mobility, and the industrial base. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCBC29EA5838844729D2A93E9ED7A5F92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Technological advances that are expected to increase efficiency of and reduce demand for tactical wheeled vehicles.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2EF27F31FFFB4C1BB3D8E54B3A035788" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Considerations In developing each strategy required by subsection (a), the Secretary of the Army shall consider the following objectives and factors: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H606954935A0248D0BB6864FCBC472576" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Objectives relating to protection, fleet operations, mission command, mobility, and the industrial base. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCBC29EA5838844729D2A93E9ED7A5F92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Technological advances that are expected to increase efficiency of and reduce demand for tactical wheeled vehicles. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7B9080ED472648058DDCC3712CE45804" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Technological advances that allow for the operation of tactical wheeled vehicles in a variety of climate and geographic conditions.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA16336ABAD254DEF89D69A0FD0701631" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Existing commercial technologies such as vehicle electrification, autonomous capabilities, and predictive maintenance, among others. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H939672B35BD741CDACD5071A0544AA92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) The capabilities of autonomous equivalents to tactical wheeled vehicles. Analysis.

REPORT ON ACQUISITION STRATEGIES FOR THE LOGISTICS AUGMENTATION PROGRAM OF THE ARMY <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFEBE5F09462749A5895C80B984A99D9C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general Review. The Secretary of the Army, in consultation with the Secretary of Defense and the commanders of the geographic combatant commands, shall conduct a review of the proposed recompete of the operational task orders of the geographic combatant commands under the LOGCAP V contract. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H85D3E02BE39A4EEDA29C82815238BB7A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Elements The review required by subsection (a) shall include the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H74DB6A1CD871498A96677DDE57FEA9A2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) A business case analysis of the cost and operational benefit of recompeting the task orders described in subsection (a).

10 USC 3702. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBFB4753D90BE4EA08A20CD47B024270D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the quality and timing of the work performed under the task orders described in such subsection; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD6BFBAB575C84847863BFFB0C266F4F6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the ability of the Army to transition to the LOGCAP VI contract, including any effects on the quality and timing of such transition. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD13151924ED042228A130BBF2F8D58AA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) An analysis of recompeting the task orders described in subsection (a) compared to transitioning directly to the LOGCAP VI contract instead of recompeting such task orders.

LIMITATION ON AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS PENDING ASSESSMENT OF ARMY TRACKLESS MOVING TARGET SYSTEMS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA043221C28A6476DAAAA3AC67B32CC93" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general Russia. China.

Timelines. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB462EE419E9A41E689A004B6384CC7E8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) comparing the performance of such variant against the applicable program requirements set forth in the report of Secretary of the Army titled <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Autonomous Robotic Targets for Small Arms Range Training, as submitted to Congress in March 2023; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H089EC2A386594972AB3BC7F7CEE20EF7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) obtains direct soldier feedback on the current Trackless Moving Target program; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H485DFF634EC5490D827F73F2E8D2A6AE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) certifies to the congressional defense committees that the acquisition strategy of the Army for the Trackless Moving Target–Infantry variant meets the program requirements set forth in the report referred to in paragraph (1)(B); and Certification. Requirements.

Not later than 30 days after the date of the completion of the assessment and soldier feedback required under paragraphs (1) and (2) of subsection (a), the Secretary of the Army shall submit to the congressional defense committees a report that includes— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8FBE96490DD54A43A5A4B8EE8EB2613C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) detailed results of the assessment conducted under subsection (a)(1), including a comparison of the Trackless Moving Target–Infantry variant under development by the Army to other operationally deployed, commercially available targets in use by other Armed Forces; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3CC0E713D220428FBE8E6142471BB421" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) a summary of the soldier feedback obtained under subsection (a)(2); and Summary. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEEAC5698B9AC40E385D9242A67930594" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) a certification that the development of the Trackless Moving Target–Infantry variant is in compliance with the requirements of section 4061 of title 10, United States Code.

MULTIYEAR PROCUREMENT AUTHORITY FOR DOMESTICALLY PROCESSED CRITICAL MINERALS 50 USC 98e-2. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEF380BC684B54B12A0EC49B407241D0D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Authority for multiyear procurement Subject to section 3501 of title 10, United States Code, and from amounts made available by discretionary appropriations Acts from the National Defense Stockpile Transaction Fund (as established under section 9(a) of the Strategic and Critical Materials Stock Piling Act (50 U.S.C. 98h(a))) after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Defense may enter into one or more multiyear contracts for the procurement of critical minerals that are processed in the United States by domestic sources.

). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE6C05A5ACD0D40D69F7679A2B957196B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Authority for advance procurement The Secretary of Defense may enter into one or more contracts, beginning in fiscal year 2024, for advance procurement associated with the domestically processed critical minerals for which authorization to enter into a multiyear procurement contract is provided under subsection (a). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4B97D85B555744889FC0254CE41580BB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Condition for out-year contract payments A contract entered into under subsection (a) shall provide that any obligation of the United States to make a payment under the contract for a fiscal year after fiscal year 2024 is subject to the availability of appropriations or funds for that purpose for such later fiscal year.

MODIFICATION OF REQUIREMENTS FOR MINIMUM NUMBER OF CARRIER AIR WINGS OF THE NAVY <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H78A8F8BED54F4038A3BB310271591F94" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Modification of requirements <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4E9C95B41FB94350A39DDBFAE483030B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Subsection (e) of section 8062 of title 10, United States Code, is amended to read as follows— <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HE9E147071C744211A3AA724DBC91FF86" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF788454C1A954E6CA2B6445B4E9A8054" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) The Secretary of the Navy shall ensure that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H32A02494D72B4618B456B21752442996" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the Navy maintains a minimum of 9 carrier air wings; and Definitions. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H54FFC599A5344470B53A3621C2762D90" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) for each such carrier air wing, the Navy maintains a dedicated and fully staffed headquarters.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H446900868C2F4610A12426F9A1904F1B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Analysis and report <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBE3ABD1AD7134B6FA907E762E45C417A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Determination. The Secretary of the Navy shall conduct an analysis of potential approaches to the manning, operation, and deployment of a 10th aircraft carrier and associated carrier air wing to determine how the Navy can mobilize such a carrier and air wing if required by operational needs. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6499F5C58B6943A2AD3A2E97609B2C3B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Elements The analysis under paragraph (1) shall address the following: <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2AF584A0C6424B05918D26D1761311C3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) The timeline associated with removing an aircraft carrier from each the following maintenance availability types: Timeline.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDE9F7D87376646DA9DEB0292F7705E06" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) The potential for deployment of a 10th aircraft carrier without a fully manned carrier air wing in the event the Navy only operates and crews 9 carrier air wings at the time deployment of a 10th aircraft carrier is required. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB2E2AE7F04984BF0BB5806DCDA83BAB1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) The potential for additional forward deployed squadrons that could support an aircraft carrier during theater operations that may not have a fully embarked air wing at the time of embarkation. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H24D7CFA0C6FA45B3B114EC423B7606A6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Report Following completion of the analysis required under paragraph (1), Secretary of the Navy shall submit to the congressional defense committees a report on the results of the analysis.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDE9F7D87376646DA9DEB0292F7705E06" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) The potential for deployment of a 10th aircraft carrier without a fully manned carrier air wing in the event the Navy only operates and crews 9 carrier air wings at the time deployment of a 10th aircraft carrier is required. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB2E2AE7F04984BF0BB5806DCDA83BAB1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) The potential for additional forward deployed squadrons that could support an aircraft carrier during theater operations that may not have a fully embarked air wing at the time of embarkation. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H24D7CFA0C6FA45B3B114EC423B7606A6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Report Following completion of the analysis required under paragraph (1), Secretary of the Navy shall submit to the congressional defense committees a report on the results of the analysis.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H88E2B0BBE543424DBBADE798626F5593" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Annual report Not later than 10 days after the date on which the budget of the President for a fiscal year is submitted to Congress pursuant to section 1105 of title 31, the Secretary of Defense shall submit to the congressional defense committees a report on any major weapon systems proposed to be divested, re-prioritized, or retired in such budget. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2000AA287A944338BDB4FEEA261BD785" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Contents Each report under subsection (a) shall include the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8C6D52D5D6F94C7383FBFB69B3226436" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Identification of each major weapon system the Secretary of Defense proposes to divest, re-prioritize, or retire in the period of five fiscal years following the date of the report. Time period.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEE177C29DF0F4A09A60A3810E540B02F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) For each proposed divestment, re-prioritization, or retirement, an explanation of— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H108F28E56A3C4EE8B0FF1A6AA324698A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the timeline for the divestment, re-prioritization, or retirement, including any factors that may affect such timelines positively or negatively; Timeline. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA7798163C738486681E0C2D1B7C38CAE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) any cost savings associated with the divestment, re-prioritization, or retirement; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6EC9C7B70CA44FB9A83F14E701A4F77D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) the rationale for the divestment, re-prioritization, or retirement, including a qualitative description of the risk associated with the divestment, re-prioritization, or retirement based on the most recent National Defense Strategy (as of the date of the report); <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1506D298B75F4C1988A03F2933D4DB11" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) any critical dependencies with other program efforts that might affect the timeline for such divestment, reprioritization, or retirement; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7FB14DF6ED034E3C89195995F4B67C5F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) the expected disposition of the weapon system after divestment, re-prioritization or retirement; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC8A4A7DE3E9248339D16C76EEBF78094" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) identification of the system or systems that are expected to satisfy the military requirements that were fulfilled by the weapon system once the divestment, re-prioritization, or retirement of that weapon system is completed. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3B096BBBF3494B73BCAA7E5B1C278F0A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Relationship to other reports The Secretary of Defense shall ensure that the report required under subsection (a) is deconflicted with the report required under section 222e of this title.

MULTIYEAR PROCUREMENT AUTHORITY FOR VIRGINIA CLASS SUBMARINE PROGRAM <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0CA73C65C3A54883AD0714EB31392AA6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Authority for multiyear procurement Subject to section 3501 of title 10, United States Code, the Secretary of the Navy may enter into one or more multiyear contracts for the procurement of not more than 13 Virginia class submarines. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H95E999F29D2E494CBA3D6212C96064FB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Authority 137 STAT.

170 fiscal year 2024, for advance procurement associated with the Virginia class submarines for which authorization to enter into a multiyear procurement contract is provided under subsection (a) and for equipment or subsystems associated with the Virginia class submarine program, including procurement of— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H35C40D94D37344FC95651D228499238B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) long lead time material; or <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6F1CC0B07B624ACE8810597A682BA6F1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) material or equipment in economic order quantities when cost savings are achievable. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9D2D23744F2E476FABACFB61AAAECB42" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Condition for out-year contract payments A contract entered into under subsection (a) shall provide that any obligation of the United States to make a payment under the contract for a fiscal year after fiscal year 2025 is subject to the availability of appropriations or funds for that purpose for such later fiscal year. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF0AC0F60ED8244BA9534E0AD9DD51268" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Limitation on termination liability A contract for the construction of Virginia class submarines entered into under subsection (a) shall include a clause that limits the liability of the United States to the contractor for any termination of the contract.

Beginning in fiscal year 2024, the Secretary of the Navy may enter into one or more contracts for the procurement of up to six Auxiliary Personnel Lighter class vessels and associated material. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD7A0C68467EE4F61A67DB334F214ED87" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Liability Any contract entered into under subsection (a) shall provide that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBBB7F5DFD4814DF8ADFCF58B04CD8156" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) any obligation of the United States to make a payment under the contract is subject to the availability of appropriations for that purpose; and Payments. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H650CB63E652942EFB7105E5662DA18F1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the total liability of the Federal Government for termination of the contract shall be limited to the total amount of funding obligated to the contract at the time of termination.

Beginning in fiscal year 2024, the Secretary of the Navy may enter into one or more contracts for the procurement of up to six Auxiliary Personnel Lighter class vessels and associated material. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD7A0C68467EE4F61A67DB334F214ED87" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Liability Any contract entered into under subsection (a) shall provide that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBBB7F5DFD4814DF8ADFCF58B04CD8156" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) any obligation of the United States to make a payment under the contract is subject to the availability of appropriations for that purpose; and Payments. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H650CB63E652942EFB7105E5662DA18F1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the total liability of the Federal Government for termination of the contract shall be limited to the total amount of funding obligated to the contract at the time of termination.

LIMITATION ON ACTIONS RELATING TO REMOTE VISION SYSTEMS OF KC–46A AIRCRAFT <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2833BB58A1764452A70FC9FA496D14FD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Limitation Certification. The Secretary of the Air Force may not take any action described in subsection (b) until the date on which the Secretary certifies to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and the House of Representatives that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1220CBFB39BD4A74882F0233702EB609" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the Secretary has identified a solution to fix the remote vision systems of KC–46A aircraft; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H023DE6EA31EF4FD8B1EE2005F9B21D2F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) such solution resolves all issues identified in the category 1 deficiency reports for such systems, except for issues relating to the panoramic system. 10 USC prec.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H99DAD9276CCE4E8AADC77DFF93F7D431" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Actions described The actions described in this subsection are the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCE890546977F4FB892FD390AFC2BF4DF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Approving the incorporation of version 2.0 of the KC–46A remote vision system into production aircraft (other than an aircraft specifically used to test and validate that version of the system). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCEE7D42323044C138FB5F37DC7735001" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Retrofitting aircraft with version 2.0 of the KC–46A remote vision system (other than an aircraft specifically used to test and validate that version of the system 137 STAT. 178 ).

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4F8BE3CDDBAB4C37B59F2FEEB43EE4B5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Plan required The Secretary of the Air Force, in consultation with the Director of the Air National Guard and the Commander of the Air Force Reserve, shall develop a long-term tactical fighter force structure, recapitalization, training, and sustainment plan for the active and reserve components of the Air Force. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7BCCBD72F62042D6A5F6824B39324D90" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Elements The plan under subsection (a) shall address each of the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBAA5C43249E647DF9BB6DC4F54609E64" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) The appropriate mix of tactical fighter aircraft force structure, with accompanying operational risk analyses, required for the Secretary of the Air Force to meet expected steady-state, global force management allocation plans and geographical combatant commander contingency operational plans tasked to the Air Force using active and reserve component units. Analyses.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5DBE4B86AD9746AB8EEB9A9637B0E1DF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) Any plans of the Secretary to augment or supplant existing piloted tactical fighter aircraft training events via acquisition and fielding of common, joint, all-domain, high-fidelity synthetic simulation environments. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H02F9A825BE2045BAA561539F9F50CD92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report Not later than April 1, 2024, the Secretary of the Air Force shall submit to the congressional defense committees a report that includes the plan developed under subsection (a 137 STAT. 179 ).

In the budget justification materials submitted in support of the budget of the Department of Defense (as submitted with the budget of the President under section 1105(a) of title 31, United States Code) for each of fiscal years 2025, 2030, and 2035, the Secretary of the Army shall include a report on the strategy of the Army for tactical wheeled vehicles. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDD470F6ED8064327AF167A5ADB18F542" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Requirements for strategy Each strategy required by subsection (a) shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8BBD896CACD64EFCA854CE1B3A7B876D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) align with the applicable national defense strategy under section 113(g) of title 10, United States Code, and applicable policies; 10 USC prec. 971.

3043); and 50 USC 3244. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2FAD58E314A349D48A53798BC8E71167" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) define capabilities and capacity requirements across the entire fleet of tactical wheeled vehicles, including— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3FFD41086A7D47AD8399A92D13975790" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) light, medium, and heavy tactical wheeled vehicles; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2E6AD8A423C143B081F4EE71BFBE18F8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) associated trailer and support equipment. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD17878DDD8CF48E6B1D16D04DAF5EFEB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Strategy elements Each strategy required by subsection (a) shall include the following: 137 STAT.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCBC29EA5838844729D2A93E9ED7A5F92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Technological advances that are expected to increase efficiency of and reduce demand for tactical wheeled vehicles. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7B9080ED472648058DDCC3712CE45804" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Technological advances that allow for the operation of tactical wheeled vehicles in a variety of climate and geographic conditions. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA16336ABAD254DEF89D69A0FD0701631" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Existing commercial technologies such as vehicle electrification, autonomous capabilities, and predictive maintenance, among others.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF3EF26D261D74C0AA73D08DC8D03E746" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of the Army shall submit to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and the House of Representatives a report on the results of the review conducted under subsection (a), including the results of the review with respect to each element specified in subsection (b). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAB1CBE15E5BE4A81AEDDD33CC6900647" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Definitions In this section: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAD95566EBE52432499E688E2D3F9073E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">LOGCAP V contract means the contract for the logistics augmentation program of the Army that is due to expire in 2028. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCECE06A9272345A2AAEC096412B3CD01" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">LOGCAP VI contract means a successor contract for the logistics augmentation program of the Army that is expected to be entered into following the expiration of the LOGCAP V contract.

LIMITATIONS AND MINIMUM INVENTORY REQUIREMENT RELATING TO RQ–4 AIRCRAFT Section 9062 of title 10, United States Code, as amended by section 131, is further amended by adding at the end the following new subsection: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HD4597476F48E46139EFDF301BECB9083" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H86E8D3B4E10E4292A8C0E6E28EF63571" qb-display-quote="yes"> (m) <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H22C0C6A14A274A28A8F7BA6D28475F35" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) During the period beginning on the date of the enactment of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2024 and ending on September 30, 2028, the Secretary of the Air Force may not— Time period. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEA92FC4BE6CD4507809A45DB1F14CA40" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) retire an RQ–4 aircraft; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4ECA54C610994E83BA979BF2349C0532" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) reduce funding for unit personnel or weapon system sustainment activities for RQ–4 aircraft in a manner that presumes future congressional authority to divest such aircraft; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBDD7D82320A849B3A5012036FFD0B0E5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) keep an RQ–4 aircraft in a status considered excess to the requirements of the possessing command and awaiting disposition instructions (commonly referred to as <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">XJ status); or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H23E53E0EFADF4C32867945FBC277765D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) decrease the total aircraft inventory of RQ–4 aircraft below 10 aircraft. 137 STAT.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6EB4204F56AA402686B7EAE876851A57" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 138. PROCUREMENT AUTHORITY FOR OVER-THE-HORIZON RADAR SYSTEMS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD725F3B0A7FD41BBA59FD00E32139BE4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general As soon as practicable after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of the Air Force shall seek to enter into one or more contracts for the procurement of up to six over-the-horizon radar systems that meet the requirements of the United States Northern Command with respect to the detection of increasingly complex threats. 137 STAT.

175 <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5A2447BC5720433C91B7AE5C63F65787" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Use of competitive procedures and sole-source contracts <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3520AA0DEA9D4623A5A7E52165AE802B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Initial contracts With respect to the award of a contract for the procurement of the first two over-the-horizon radar systems under subsection (a)— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H565DB5B16F554A9BACF9BCDD2B9B562F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the Secretary of the Air Force may use procedures other than competitive procedures (in accordance with section 3204 of title 10, United States Code) if the Secretary determines it is not feasible to use competitive procedures; and Determination. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0C4E84933EF644CBBBBC3F1B2B5F90EB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) if the Secretary makes a determination to award a sole source contract for such procurement in order to meet the requirements established by the Commander of the United States Northern Command, not later than 14 days after making such determination, the Secretary shall submit to the congressional defense committees a notification of such determination, including the rationale for such determination. Deadline.

Study.

LIMITATION ON ISSUANCE OF ACQUISITION STRATEGY FOR THE KC–135 RECAPITALIZATION PROGRAM The Secretary of the Air Force may not issue an acquisition strategy for the KC–135 recapitalization program until the date on which the Secretary submits to the congressional defense committees the following documentation: 137 STAT. 176 <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H93E46E5854444F24B36C67C1D8EC68F3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) An updated tanker roadmap timeline to include procurement of the Next Generation Air Refueling System. Update.

PROHIBITION ON AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS FOR TERMINATION OF PRODUCTION LINES FOR THE HH–60W AIRCRAFT None of the funds authorized to be appropriated by this Act or otherwise made available for fiscal year 2024 for the Air Force may be obligated or expended to terminate the operations of, or to prepare to terminate the operations of, a production line for HH–60W Combat Rescue Helicopters. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBAC6BD852BE848B28A12DC7CF7354377" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 144.

LIMITATION ON PROCUREMENT OF KC–46A AIRCRAFT <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC21E41C1976A4D8D8E453FB9E004AF91" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Limitation The Secretary of the Air Force may not procure more than six KC–46A aircraft under the final lot of the covered contract unless— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9BF4787E18BA4B6C99AC6065903727DD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCDE9240931CF462EB6476A8B691A66CD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the Secretary submits to the congressional defense committees written notice of the intent of the Secretary to procure more than six KC–46A aircraft under the final lot of the covered contract; and Notice. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1A1675208D4E4481A241A384819F524D" indent="paragraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) a period of 180 days has elapsed following the date on which such notice was submitted; or Time period.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1A1675208D4E4481A241A384819F524D" indent="paragraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) a period of 180 days has elapsed following the date on which such notice was submitted; or Time period. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H32188FF066C34B5BB2CAD8E8C8B4FD0F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the Secretary submits to the congressional defense committees written certification by the Assistant Secretary of the Air Force for Acquisition, Technology, and Logistics that— Certification. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB224532A43AF49E39F18D56905384DD6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) there are validated needs of the Air Force requiring the procurement more than six KC–46A aircraft under the final lot of the covered contract; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC74443AE99CB4ACC92F58945A2A63E6F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) cost estimates are complete for the long-term sustainment of any additional aircraft planned to be procured.

PLAN FOR LONG-TERM AIR FORCE FIGHTER FORCE STRUCTURE 10 USC 148. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4F8BE3CDDBAB4C37B59F2FEEB43EE4B5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Plan required The Secretary of the Air Force, in consultation with the Director of the Air National Guard and the Commander of the Air Force Reserve, shall develop a long-term tactical fighter force structure, recapitalization, training, and sustainment plan for the active and reserve components of the Air Force. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7BCCBD72F62042D6A5F6824B39324D90" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Elements The plan under subsection (a) shall address each of the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBAA5C43249E647DF9BB6DC4F54609E64" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) The appropriate mix of tactical fighter aircraft force structure, with accompanying operational risk analyses, required for the Secretary of the Air Force to meet expected steady-state, global force management allocation plans and geographical combatant commander contingency operational plans tasked to the Air Force using active and reserve component units.

Time period. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0B24AF1127FC4B03A4EA8292607F921A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Budget line-item details related to each major weapon system identified under paragraph (1). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEE177C29DF0F4A09A60A3810E540B02F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) For each proposed divestment, re-prioritization, or retirement, an explanation of— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H108F28E56A3C4EE8B0FF1A6AA324698A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the timeline for the divestment, re-prioritization, or retirement, including any factors that may affect such timelines positively or negatively; Timeline.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA7798163C738486681E0C2D1B7C38CAE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) any cost savings associated with the divestment, re-prioritization, or retirement; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6EC9C7B70CA44FB9A83F14E701A4F77D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) the rationale for the divestment, re-prioritization, or retirement, including a qualitative description of the risk associated with the divestment, re-prioritization, or retirement based on the most recent National Defense Strategy (as of the date of the report); <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1506D298B75F4C1988A03F2933D4DB11" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) any critical dependencies with other program efforts that might affect the timeline for such divestment, reprioritization, or retirement; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7FB14DF6ED034E3C89195995F4B67C5F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) the expected disposition of the weapon system after divestment, re-prioritization or retirement; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC8A4A7DE3E9248339D16C76EEBF78094" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) identification of the system or systems that are expected to satisfy the military requirements that were fulfilled by the weapon system once the divestment, re-prioritization, or retirement of that weapon system is completed. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3B096BBBF3494B73BCAA7E5B1C278F0A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Relationship to other reports The Secretary of Defense shall ensure that the report required under subsection (a) is deconflicted with the report required under section 222e of this title. 137 STAT.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD3AAFEFFA16042B38F57B2ADC1266B45" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 132. LIMITATIONS AND MINIMUM INVENTORY REQUIREMENT RELATING TO RQ–4 AIRCRAFT Section 9062 of title 10, United States Code, as amended by section 131, is further amended by adding at the end the following new subsection: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HD4597476F48E46139EFDF301BECB9083" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H86E8D3B4E10E4292A8C0E6E28EF63571" qb-display-quote="yes"> (m) <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H22C0C6A14A274A28A8F7BA6D28475F35" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) During the period beginning on the date of the enactment of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2024 and ending on September 30, 2028, the Secretary of the Air Force may not— Time period. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEA92FC4BE6CD4507809A45DB1F14CA40" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) retire an RQ–4 aircraft; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4ECA54C610994E83BA979BF2349C0532" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) reduce funding for unit personnel or weapon system sustainment activities for RQ–4 aircraft in a manner that presumes future congressional authority to divest such aircraft; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBDD7D82320A849B3A5012036FFD0B0E5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) keep an RQ–4 aircraft in a status considered excess to the requirements of the possessing command and awaiting disposition instructions (commonly referred to as <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">XJ status); or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H23E53E0EFADF4C32867945FBC277765D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) decrease the total aircraft inventory of RQ–4 aircraft below 10 aircraft.

Following expiration of the covered period, the minimum primary mission aircraft inventory requirements specified in section 9062(i)(1) of title 10, United States Code, shall apply as if this section had not been enacted. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF9FCCBD534254C1C9A872B8E392B5E8C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Definitions In this section: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB9B8F80A15E4483AAF153E77BAAA99EF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">covered period means the period beginning on the date of the enactment of this Act and ending on October 1, 2024. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2B5CB2C79A0F4FEDB571475E4536E020" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) The terms <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">fighter aircraft and <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">primary mission aircraft inventory have the meanings given those terms in section 9062(i)(2) of title 10, United States Code.

MODIFICATION TO PROHIBITION ON CERTAIN REDUCTIONS TO B–1 BOMBER AIRCRAFT SQUADRONS Section 133 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2022 (Public Law 117–81; 135 Stat. 1574) is amended— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4F8BE4C9A5AA4041B8125E99B7EB7300" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) by amending subsection (b) to read as follows: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HCCC6751CB5D347629E7CAB537478E93F" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H10C87114AD614F8988810EF03853EF50" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Exceptions The prohibition under subsection (a) shall not apply— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H26A68481074342DC9CF32714A3E6A73B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) to a bomb wing for which the Secretary of the Air Force has commenced the process of replacing B–1 bomber aircraft with B–21 bomber aircraft; or <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H98CECE0DA2504DA2964B13B4B86A4180" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) so as to prohibit the retirement of the individual B–1 aircraft designated 85–0089, which has been determined by Secretary of the Air Force to be no longer mission capable and uneconomical to repair due to damage sustained on April 20, 2022. Determination.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6EB4204F56AA402686B7EAE876851A57" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 138. PROCUREMENT AUTHORITY FOR OVER-THE-HORIZON RADAR SYSTEMS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD725F3B0A7FD41BBA59FD00E32139BE4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general As soon as practicable after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of the Air Force shall seek to enter into one or more contracts for the procurement of up to six over-the-horizon radar systems that meet the requirements of the United States Northern Command with respect to the detection of increasingly complex threats. 137 STAT.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H762E000744DB4A869F31CBBFBB83E5BC" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 139. PROHIBITION ON AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS FOR RETIREMENT OF KC–135 AIRCRAFT <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC1B636916B1B44B5909232E1436C831C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Prohibition Except as provided in subsection (b), none of the funds authorized to be appropriated by this Act or otherwise made available for fiscal year 2024 for the Air Force may be obligated or expended to retire, or prepare to retire, a KC–135 aircraft. Study.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB2214A22062049F59AE6B1B154B83DBD" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 141. LIMITATION ON ISSUANCE OF ACQUISITION STRATEGY FOR THE KC–135 RECAPITALIZATION PROGRAM The Secretary of the Air Force may not issue an acquisition strategy for the KC–135 recapitalization program until the date on which the Secretary submits to the congressional defense committees the following documentation: 137 STAT. 176 <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H93E46E5854444F24B36C67C1D8EC68F3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) An updated tanker roadmap timeline to include procurement of the Next Generation Air Refueling System.

The limitation under subsection (a) shall not apply to individual F–16C/D aircraft that the Secretary of the Air Force determines, on a case-by-case basis, to be no longer mission capable and uneconomical to repair because of aircraft accidents, mishaps, or excessive material degradation and non-airworthiness status of certain aircraft. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1DA59BB6176A4EB6B813179AC4B0B746" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Information to Congress For each F–16C/D aircraft that the Secretary of the Air Force proposes to retire in a fiscal year, the Secretary shall include, in the materials submitted by the Secretary in support of the budget of the President for that 137 STAT. 177 fiscal year (as submitted to Congress under section 1105(a) of title 31, United States Code), a description of— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDFA4D12FBD6E46B5A5677D7B70ECA5FB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) each upgrade and modification made to such aircraft, including— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC1610D54233E45F1AAE9AE9F2DD8E905" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the date of the upgrade or modification; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA5B24638B2F649E7AA49B170FA71407A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the cost of such upgrade or modification in current year dollars; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H33A4CEE857634669A52D66B1097031B2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the estimated remaining service-life (expressed as equivalent flight hours and years) of— Estimate.

LIMITATION ON RETIREMENT OF T–1A TRAINING AIRCRAFT The Secretary of the Air Force may not retire, prepare to retire, or place in storage or on backup aircraft inventory status any T–1A training aircraft until the date on which the Secretary submits to the congressional defense committees— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H84F5E66F03A847F2A76C877F2B62D56D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) a certification indicating that the Secretary has completed the full, fleet-wide implementation of the Undergraduate Pilot Training curriculum (formerly known as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Undergraduate Pilot Training 2.5 curriculum); and Certification.

PLAN FOR LONG-TERM AIR FORCE FIGHTER FORCE STRUCTURE 10 USC 148. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4F8BE3CDDBAB4C37B59F2FEEB43EE4B5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Plan required The Secretary of the Air Force, in consultation with the Director of the Air National Guard and the Commander of the Air Force Reserve, shall develop a long-term tactical fighter force structure, recapitalization, training, and sustainment plan for the active and reserve components of the Air Force. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7BCCBD72F62042D6A5F6824B39324D90" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Elements The plan under subsection (a) shall address each of the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBAA5C43249E647DF9BB6DC4F54609E64" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) The appropriate mix of tactical fighter aircraft force structure, with accompanying operational risk analyses, required for the Secretary of the Air Force to meet expected steady-state, global force management allocation plans and geographical combatant commander contingency operational plans tasked to the Air Force using active and reserve component units.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE6C05A5ACD0D40D69F7679A2B957196B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Authority for advance procurement The Secretary of Defense may enter into one or more contracts, beginning in fiscal year 2024, for advance procurement associated with the domestically processed critical minerals for which authorization to enter into a multiyear procurement contract is provided under subsection (a). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4B97D85B555744889FC0254CE41580BB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Condition for out-year contract payments A contract entered into under subsection (a) shall provide that any obligation of the United States to make a payment under the contract for a fiscal year after fiscal year 2024 is subject to the availability of appropriations or funds for that purpose for such later fiscal year. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC9662D25CC794DC0A980526686ABDDDE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Definitions In this section: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFB00AB8A331249D2AA818D19107F3B4B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">critical mineral means a mineral determined to be a strategic and critical material under section 3(a) of the Strategic and Critical Materials Stock Piling Act (50 U.S.C.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4B97D85B555744889FC0254CE41580BB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Condition for out-year contract payments A contract entered into under subsection (a) shall provide that any obligation of the United States to make a payment under the contract for a fiscal year after fiscal year 2024 is subject to the availability of appropriations or funds for that purpose for such later fiscal year. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC9662D25CC794DC0A980526686ABDDDE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Definitions In this section: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFB00AB8A331249D2AA818D19107F3B4B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">critical mineral means a mineral determined to be a strategic and critical material under section 3(a) of the Strategic and Critical Materials Stock Piling Act (50 U.S.C. 98b(a)).

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB00DD9E19F654AF6AB5141BE12C6E4F4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Applicability Subsection (a) shall not apply to a contract for the procurement of a tactical tracked vehicle or tactical wheeled vehicle entered into before the date of the enactment of this Act. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H093F4EA454BD4BDEB58C89A273FDE23C" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 154.
