Of the funds authorized to be appropriated by this Act or otherwise made available for fiscal year 2024 for the Trackless Moving Target program of the Army, not more than 75 percent may be obligated or expended to procure or further develop the Trackless Moving Target–Infantry variant until the Secretary of the Army— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H36CA229DB8A940A3B56295D56AA81CA9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) acting through the Army Combat Capabilities Development Command, conducts an assessment of the Trackless Moving Target–Infantry variant, which shall include— 137 STAT. 166 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5647994E9B21490BBC159B26447A5794" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) obtaining end-user feedback regarding such variant; and List.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC64DC9D69B884EE6AF1C9467C801C3DF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Report required Determination. Not later than 30 days after the date of the completion of the assessment and soldier feedback required under paragraphs (1) and (2) of subsection (a), the Secretary of the Army shall submit to the congressional defense committees a report that includes— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8FBE96490DD54A43A5A4B8EE8EB2613C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) detailed results of the assessment conducted under subsection (a)(1), including a comparison of the Trackless Moving Target–Infantry variant under development by the Army to other operationally deployed, commercially available targets in use by other Armed Forces; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3CC0E713D220428FBE8E6142471BB421" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) a summary of the soldier feedback obtained under subsection (a)(2); and Summary. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEEAC5698B9AC40E385D9242A67930594" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) a certification that the development of the Trackless Moving Target–Infantry variant is in compliance with the requirements of section 4061 of title 10, United States Code.

In the budget justification materials submitted in support of the budget of the Department of Defense (as submitted with the budget of the President under section 1105(a) of title 31, United States Code) for each of fiscal years 2025, 2030, and 2035, the Secretary of the Army shall include a report on the strategy of the Army for tactical wheeled vehicles. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDD470F6ED8064327AF167A5ADB18F542" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Requirements for strategy Each strategy required by subsection (a) shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8BBD896CACD64EFCA854CE1B3A7B876D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) align with the applicable national defense strategy under section 113(g) of title 10, United States Code, and applicable policies; 10 USC prec. 971.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD17878DDD8CF48E6B1D16D04DAF5EFEB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Strategy elements Each strategy required by subsection (a) shall include the following: 137 STAT. 167 <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5445688E9C064083BE1D46715E049FBD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) A detailed program for the construction of light, medium, and heavy tactical wheeled vehicles for the Army over the period of five fiscal years following the date of the strategy. Time period.

Cost estimate. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2EF27F31FFFB4C1BB3D8E54B3A035788" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Considerations In developing each strategy required by subsection (a), the Secretary of the Army shall consider the following objectives and factors: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H606954935A0248D0BB6864FCBC472576" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Objectives relating to protection, fleet operations, mission command, mobility, and the industrial base. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCBC29EA5838844729D2A93E9ED7A5F92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Technological advances that are expected to increase efficiency of and reduce demand for tactical wheeled vehicles.

Analysis. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5A5490EA2C5842E89DAF2F6C6677B62B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) An overview of potential innovations and efficiencies derived from a competition for the LOGCAP VI contract. Overview.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H57CEF3ECD87D4BC49F72AC862EFD5568" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) An explanation of the benefit of recompeting the task orders described in subsection (a) compared to conducting an open competition for the LOGCAP VI contract instead of recompeting such task orders. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5EDDB9544307476EB161C7961DAFE26D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) A breakdown of any additional authorities needed to move directly to the LOGCAP VI contract instead of recompeting the task orders described in subsection (a). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF3EF26D261D74C0AA73D08DC8D03E746" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of the Army shall submit to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and the House of Representatives a report on the results of the review conducted under subsection (a), including the results of the review with respect to each element specified in subsection (b).

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5EDDB9544307476EB161C7961DAFE26D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) A breakdown of any additional authorities needed to move directly to the LOGCAP VI contract instead of recompeting the task orders described in subsection (a). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF3EF26D261D74C0AA73D08DC8D03E746" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of the Army shall submit to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and the House of Representatives a report on the results of the review conducted under subsection (a), including the results of the review with respect to each element specified in subsection (b). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAB1CBE15E5BE4A81AEDDD33CC6900647" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Definitions In this section: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAD95566EBE52432499E688E2D3F9073E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">LOGCAP V contract means the contract for the logistics augmentation program of the Army that is due to expire in 2028.

<subtitle id="H0ADBD3ABDB9C49E182E4A2C3A3681BA9" qb-display-quote="yes" style="OLC"> C Navy Programs <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H440B3F6A466E4B81B6A35113434704D2" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 121. MODIFICATION OF REQUIREMENTS FOR MINIMUM NUMBER OF CARRIER AIR WINGS OF THE NAVY <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H78A8F8BED54F4038A3BB310271591F94" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Modification of requirements <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4E9C95B41FB94350A39DDBFAE483030B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Subsection (e) of section 8062 of title 10, United States Code, is amended to read as follows— <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HE9E147071C744211A3AA724DBC91FF86" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF788454C1A954E6CA2B6445B4E9A8054" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) The Secretary of the Navy shall ensure that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H32A02494D72B4618B456B21752442996" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the Navy maintains a minimum of 9 carrier air wings; and Definitions. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H54FFC599A5344470B53A3621C2762D90" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) for each such carrier air wing, the Navy maintains a dedicated and fully staffed headquarters.
. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H30F01FA44DA34657829B1CE6CC83ACAB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Effective date Reports. 10 USC 8062 note.

The amendment made by paragraph (1) shall take effect one year after the date on which the Secretary of the Navy submits to Congress the report required under subsection (b)(3). The Secretary of the Navy shall notify the Law Revision Counsel of the House of Representatives 137 STAT. 169 of the submission of the report so that the Law Revision Counsel may execute the amendment made by paragraph (1) in accordance with the preceding sentence.

The Secretary of the Navy shall conduct an analysis of potential approaches to the manning, operation, and deployment of a 10th aircraft carrier and associated carrier air wing to determine how the Navy can mobilize such a carrier and air wing if required by operational needs. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6499F5C58B6943A2AD3A2E97609B2C3B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Elements The analysis under paragraph (1) shall address the following: <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2AF584A0C6424B05918D26D1761311C3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) The timeline associated with removing an aircraft carrier from each the following maintenance availability types: Timeline. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFDED8B00B5DB4267B509945B683EBA2B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) Complex Overhaul.

<clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFDED8B00B5DB4267B509945B683EBA2B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) Complex Overhaul. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H82B2BB3CF71543F9B26B11F1029703D2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) Selected Restricted Availability. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H95AA83810C4847CF844E54302F70D466" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) Docking Selected Restricted Availability.

Costs. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDE9F7D87376646DA9DEB0292F7705E06" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) The potential for deployment of a 10th aircraft carrier without a fully manned carrier air wing in the event the Navy only operates and crews 9 carrier air wings at the time deployment of a 10th aircraft carrier is required. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB2E2AE7F04984BF0BB5806DCDA83BAB1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) The potential for additional forward deployed squadrons that could support an aircraft carrier during theater operations that may not have a fully embarked air wing at the time of embarkation.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9D2D23744F2E476FABACFB61AAAECB42" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Condition for out-year contract payments A contract entered into under subsection (a) shall provide that any obligation of the United States to make a payment under the contract for a fiscal year after fiscal year 2025 is subject to the availability of appropriations or funds for that purpose for such later fiscal year. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF0AC0F60ED8244BA9534E0AD9DD51268" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Limitation on termination liability A contract for the construction of Virginia class submarines entered into under subsection (a) shall include a clause that limits the liability of the United States to the contractor for any termination of the contract. The maximum liability of the United States under the clause shall be the amount appropriated for the submarines covered by the contract regardless of the amount obligated under the contract.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAE72088958C44020876AFEE4D9793052" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Exception Certification. ANNUAL REPORTS ON USE OF GOVERNMENT DOCKS FOR SHIP REPAIR AND MAINTENANCE Not later than June 30, 2024, and on an annual basis thereafter through 2028, the Secretary of the Navy shall submit to the congressional defense committees a report that— Time period. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDD3A8CF5C1EE4317BD9B114A2A7EE603" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) identifies each instance in the year preceding the date of the report in which the Navy used a Government dock for a ship repair and maintenance availability when sufficient capacity was available in private docks during the period in which such repairs and maintenance were expected to be performed; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF2868CE9C84E48929D5D6506B3D56CD7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) for each such instance, provides an explanation of the reasons the Navy used a Government dock rather than a private dock. <subtitle id="H97F521CE21264FF7A45F6B17330F7EF5" qb-display-quote="yes" style="OLC"> D Air Force Programs <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD604604F41284CB89160FD1324942960" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 131.

MULTIYEAR PROCUREMENT AUTHORITY FOR VIRGINIA CLASS SUBMARINE PROGRAM <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0CA73C65C3A54883AD0714EB31392AA6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Authority for multiyear procurement Subject to section 3501 of title 10, United States Code, the Secretary of the Navy may enter into one or more multiyear contracts for the procurement of not more than 13 Virginia class submarines. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H95E999F29D2E494CBA3D6212C96064FB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Authority 137 STAT. 328 for advance procurement Effective date.

170 fiscal year 2024, for advance procurement associated with the Virginia class submarines for which authorization to enter into a multiyear procurement contract is provided under subsection (a) and for equipment or subsystems associated with the Virginia class submarine program, including procurement of— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H35C40D94D37344FC95651D228499238B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) long lead time material; or <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6F1CC0B07B624ACE8810597A682BA6F1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) material or equipment in economic order quantities when cost savings are achievable. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9D2D23744F2E476FABACFB61AAAECB42" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Condition for out-year contract payments A contract entered into under subsection (a) shall provide that any obligation of the United States to make a payment under the contract for a fiscal year after fiscal year 2025 is subject to the availability of appropriations or funds for that purpose for such later fiscal year. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF0AC0F60ED8244BA9534E0AD9DD51268" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Limitation on termination liability A contract for the construction of Virginia class submarines entered into under subsection (a) shall include a clause that limits the liability of the United States to the contractor for any termination of the contract.

The maximum liability of the United States under the clause shall be the amount appropriated for the submarines covered by the contract regardless of the amount obligated under the contract. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC6C812521B0448858AC62C098889C552" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Virginia class submarine defined The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Virginia class submarine means a block VI configured Virginia class submarine. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE575D1964AB3416EBA2E1BC4FF6F62B1" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 124.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA5503D4270FB44E6A9B00BFB36780747" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 140. PROHIBITION ON REDUCTION OF KC–135 AIRCRAFT IN PMAI OF THE RESERVE COMPONENTS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC0EBFFF0F2044091B8F40103071F1C24" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Prohibition None of the funds authorized to be appropriated by this Act or otherwise made available for fiscal year 2024 for the Air Force may be obligated or expended to reduce the number of KC–135 aircraft designated as primary mission aircraft inventory within the reserve components of the Air Force. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HACF5EED8F3684912AD00CB90B2533B8D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Primary mission aircraft inventory defined In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">primary mission aircraft inventory has the meaning given that term in section 9062(i)(2)(B) of title 10, United States Code.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA5503D4270FB44E6A9B00BFB36780747" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 140. PROHIBITION ON REDUCTION OF KC–135 AIRCRAFT IN PMAI OF THE RESERVE COMPONENTS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC0EBFFF0F2044091B8F40103071F1C24" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Prohibition None of the funds authorized to be appropriated by this Act or otherwise made available for fiscal year 2024 for the Air Force may be obligated or expended to reduce the number of KC–135 aircraft designated as primary mission aircraft inventory within the reserve components of the Air Force. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HACF5EED8F3684912AD00CB90B2533B8D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Primary mission aircraft inventory defined In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">primary mission aircraft inventory has the meaning given that term in section 9062(i)(2)(B) of title 10, United States Code.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC26442980AF042C0B10B041E07B90840" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 142. PROHIBITION ON CERTAIN REDUCTIONS TO INVENTORY OF E–3 AIRBORNE WARNING AND CONTROL SYSTEM AIRCRAFT <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAB85745946724E40B1092562E02AB415" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Prohibition Except as provided in subsections (b) and (c), none of the funds authorized to be appropriated by this Act or otherwise made available for fiscal year 2024 for the Air Force may be obligated or expended to retire, prepare to retire, or place in storage or in backup aircraft inventory any E–3 aircraft if such actions would reduce the total aircraft inventory of such aircraft below 16. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H757ECB93781540FA8AA46E3930697FE6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Exception for plan Effective date.

If the Secretary of the Air Force submits to the congressional defense committees a plan for maintaining readiness and ensuring there is no lapse in mission capabilities, the prohibition under subsection (a) shall not apply to actions taken to reduce the total aircraft inventory of E–3 aircraft to below 16, beginning 30 days after the date on which the plan is so submitted. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDEFBC2AD68714867AD2E9DAFFD604ABF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Exception for E–7 procurement If the Secretary of the Air Force procures enough E–7 Wedgetail aircraft to accomplish the required mission load, the prohibition under subsection (a) shall not apply to actions taken to reduce the total aircraft inventory of E–3 aircraft to below 16 after the date on which such E–7 Wedgetail aircraft are delivered. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7047BE6E89FF438FAF154FE30352F276" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 143.

The Secretary of the Air Force may not take any action described in subsection (b) until the date on which the Secretary certifies to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and the House of Representatives that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1220CBFB39BD4A74882F0233702EB609" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the Secretary has identified a solution to fix the remote vision systems of KC–46A aircraft; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H023DE6EA31EF4FD8B1EE2005F9B21D2F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) such solution resolves all issues identified in the category 1 deficiency reports for such systems, except for issues relating to the panoramic system.

The Secretary of the Air Force may not take any action described in subsection (b) until the date on which the Secretary certifies to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and the House of Representatives that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1220CBFB39BD4A74882F0233702EB609" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the Secretary has identified a solution to fix the remote vision systems of KC–46A aircraft; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H023DE6EA31EF4FD8B1EE2005F9B21D2F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) such solution resolves all issues identified in the category 1 deficiency reports for such systems, except for issues relating to the panoramic system. 10 USC prec.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4F8BE3CDDBAB4C37B59F2FEEB43EE4B5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Plan required The Secretary of the Air Force, in consultation with the Director of the Air National Guard and the Commander of the Air Force Reserve, shall develop a long-term tactical fighter force structure, recapitalization, training, and sustainment plan for the active and reserve components of the Air Force. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7BCCBD72F62042D6A5F6824B39324D90" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Elements The plan under subsection (a) shall address each of the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBAA5C43249E647DF9BB6DC4F54609E64" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) The appropriate mix of tactical fighter aircraft force structure, with accompanying operational risk analyses, required for the Secretary of the Air Force to meet expected steady-state, global force management allocation plans and geographical combatant commander contingency operational plans tasked to the Air Force using active and reserve component units. Analyses.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0B24AF1127FC4B03A4EA8292607F921A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Budget line-item details related to each major weapon system identified under paragraph (1). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEE177C29DF0F4A09A60A3810E540B02F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) For each proposed divestment, re-prioritization, or retirement, an explanation of— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H108F28E56A3C4EE8B0FF1A6AA324698A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the timeline for the divestment, re-prioritization, or retirement, including any factors that may affect such timelines positively or negatively; MULTIYEAR PROCUREMENT AUTHORITY FOR DOMESTICALLY PROCESSED CRITICAL MINERALS 50 USC 98e-2. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEF380BC684B54B12A0EC49B407241D0D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Authority for multiyear procurement Subject to section 3501 of title 10, United States Code, and from amounts made available by discretionary appropriations Acts from the National Defense Stockpile Transaction Fund (as established under section 9(a) of the Strategic and Critical Materials Stock Piling Act (50 U.S.C. 98h(a))) after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Defense may enter into one or more multiyear contracts for the procurement of critical minerals that are processed in the United States by domestic sources.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE6C05A5ACD0D40D69F7679A2B957196B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Authority for advance procurement The Secretary of Defense may enter into one or more contracts, beginning in fiscal year 2024, for advance procurement associated with the domestically processed critical minerals for which authorization to enter into a multiyear procurement contract is provided under subsection (a). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4B97D85B555744889FC0254CE41580BB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Condition for out-year contract payments A contract entered into under subsection (a) shall provide that any obligation of the United States to make a payment under the contract for a fiscal year after fiscal year 2024 is subject to the availability of appropriations or funds for that purpose for such later fiscal year. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC9662D25CC794DC0A980526686ABDDDE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Definitions In this section: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFB00AB8A331249D2AA818D19107F3B4B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">critical mineral means a mineral determined to be a strategic and critical material under section 3(a) of the Strategic and Critical Materials Stock Piling Act (50 U.S.C.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4B97D85B555744889FC0254CE41580BB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Condition for out-year contract payments A contract entered into under subsection (a) shall provide that any obligation of the United States to make a payment under the contract for a fiscal year after fiscal year 2024 is subject to the availability of appropriations or funds for that purpose for such later fiscal year. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC9662D25CC794DC0A980526686ABDDDE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Definitions In this section: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFB00AB8A331249D2AA818D19107F3B4B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">critical mineral means a mineral determined to be a strategic and critical material under section 3(a) of the Strategic and Critical Materials Stock Piling Act (50 U.S.C. 98b(a)).

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF1169B32BFAC4DC694CA4A2605BFE10A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Treatment of production For purposes of this section, a battery shall be treated as produced by an entity specified in subsection (b) if that entity— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2AE8C724046E430D8FB18849FF02C8FE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) assembles or manufactures the final product; or <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF9F5B87CF34A447D9EC47C4D817E45E6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) creates or otherwise provides a majority of the components used in the battery. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H543BA4EF90AA4017B7015415697EF966" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Waiver The Secretary of Defense may waive the limitation under subsection (a). <title id="HADAF71921A204B1EBA40850E0D90E8DB" qb-display-quote="yes" style="OLC"> II RESEARCH, DEVELOPMENT, TEST, AND EVALUATION <toc container-level="title-container" lowest-level="section" quoted-block="no-quoted-block" regeneration="no-regeneration"> <toc-entry align="left" bold="off" idref="H747C3AFB0DA44CD3AAB59D9C842926E4" level="subtitle">Subtitle A—Authorization of Appropriations <toc-entry align="left" bold="off" idref="HE3935662CD3D43DE96F64A6ED4020958" level="section">Sec.

R. 2670] AN ACT To authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2024 for military activities of the Department of Defense and for military construction, and for defense activities of the Department of Energy, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, and for other purposes.

Of the funds authorized to be appropriated by this Act or otherwise made available for fiscal year 2024 for the Trackless Moving Target program of the Army, not more than 75 percent may be obligated or expended to procure or further develop the Trackless Moving Target–Infantry variant until the Secretary of the Army— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H36CA229DB8A940A3B56295D56AA81CA9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) acting through the Army Combat Capabilities Development Command, conducts an assessment of the Trackless Moving Target–Infantry variant, which shall include— 137 STAT. 166 <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5647994E9B21490BBC159B26447A5794" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) obtaining end-user feedback regarding such variant; and List. Timelines.

Timelines. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB462EE419E9A41E689A004B6384CC7E8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) comparing the performance of such variant against the applicable program requirements set forth in the report of Secretary of the Army titled <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Autonomous Robotic Targets for Small Arms Range Training, as submitted to Congress in March 2023; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H089EC2A386594972AB3BC7F7CEE20EF7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) obtains direct soldier feedback on the current Trackless Moving Target program; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H485DFF634EC5490D827F73F2E8D2A6AE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) certifies to the congressional defense committees that the acquisition strategy of the Army for the Trackless Moving Target–Infantry variant meets the program requirements set forth in the report referred to in paragraph (1)(B); and Certification. Requirements.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC64DC9D69B884EE6AF1C9467C801C3DF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Report required Determination. Not later than 30 days after the date of the completion of the assessment and soldier feedback required under paragraphs (1) and (2) of subsection (a), the Secretary of the Army shall submit to the congressional defense committees a report that includes— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8FBE96490DD54A43A5A4B8EE8EB2613C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) detailed results of the assessment conducted under subsection (a)(1), including a comparison of the Trackless Moving Target–Infantry variant under development by the Army to other operationally deployed, commercially available targets in use by other Armed Forces; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3CC0E713D220428FBE8E6142471BB421" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) a summary of the soldier feedback obtained under subsection (a)(2); and Summary. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEEAC5698B9AC40E385D9242A67930594" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) a certification that the development of the Trackless Moving Target–Infantry variant is in compliance with the requirements of section 4061 of title 10, United States Code.

In the budget justification materials submitted in support of the budget of the Department of Defense (as submitted with the budget of the President under section 1105(a) of title 31, United States Code) for each of fiscal years 2025, 2030, and 2035, the Secretary of the Army shall include a report on the strategy of the Army for tactical wheeled vehicles. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDD470F6ED8064327AF167A5ADB18F542" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Requirements for strategy Each strategy required by subsection (a) shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8BBD896CACD64EFCA854CE1B3A7B876D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) align with the applicable national defense strategy under section 113(g) of title 10, United States Code, and applicable policies; 10 USC prec. 971.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD17878DDD8CF48E6B1D16D04DAF5EFEB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Strategy elements Each strategy required by subsection (a) shall include the following: 137 STAT. 167 <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5445688E9C064083BE1D46715E049FBD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) A detailed program for the construction of light, medium, and heavy tactical wheeled vehicles for the Army over the period of five fiscal years following the date of the strategy. Cost estimate. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2EF27F31FFFB4C1BB3D8E54B3A035788" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Considerations In developing each strategy required by subsection (a), the Secretary of the Army shall consider the following objectives and factors: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H606954935A0248D0BB6864FCBC472576" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Objectives relating to protection, fleet operations, mission command, mobility, and the industrial base. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCBC29EA5838844729D2A93E9ED7A5F92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Technological advances that are expected to increase efficiency of and reduce demand for tactical wheeled vehicles.

LIMITATIONS AND MINIMUM INVENTORY REQUIREMENT RELATING TO RQ–4 AIRCRAFT Section 9062 of title 10, United States Code, as amended by section 131, is further amended by adding at the end the following new subsection: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HD4597476F48E46139EFDF301BECB9083" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H86E8D3B4E10E4292A8C0E6E28EF63571" qb-display-quote="yes"> (m) <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H22C0C6A14A274A28A8F7BA6D28475F35" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) During the period beginning on the date of the enactment of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2024 and ending on September 30, 2028, the Secretary of the Air Force may not— Time period. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEA92FC4BE6CD4507809A45DB1F14CA40" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) retire an RQ–4 aircraft; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4ECA54C610994E83BA979BF2349C0532" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) reduce funding for unit personnel or weapon system sustainment activities for RQ–4 aircraft in a manner that presumes future congressional authority to divest such aircraft; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBDD7D82320A849B3A5012036FFD0B0E5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) keep an RQ–4 aircraft in a status considered excess to the requirements of the possessing command and awaiting disposition instructions (commonly referred to as <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">XJ status); or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H23E53E0EFADF4C32867945FBC277765D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) decrease the total aircraft inventory of RQ–4 aircraft below 10 aircraft.

137 STAT. 175 <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5A2447BC5720433C91B7AE5C63F65787" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Use of competitive procedures and sole-source contracts <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3520AA0DEA9D4623A5A7E52165AE802B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Initial contracts With respect to the award of a contract for the procurement of the first two over-the-horizon radar systems under subsection (a)— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H565DB5B16F554A9BACF9BCDD2B9B562F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the Secretary of the Air Force may use procedures other than competitive procedures (in accordance with section 3204 of title 10, United States Code) if the Secretary determines it is not feasible to use competitive procedures; and Determination. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0C4E84933EF644CBBBBC3F1B2B5F90EB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) if the Secretary makes a determination to award a sole source contract for such procurement in order to meet the requirements established by the Commander of the United States Northern Command, not later than 14 days after making such determination, the Secretary shall submit to the congressional defense committees a notification of such determination, including the rationale for such determination.

PROHIBITION ON CERTAIN REDUCTIONS TO INVENTORY OF E–3 AIRBORNE WARNING AND CONTROL SYSTEM AIRCRAFT <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAB85745946724E40B1092562E02AB415" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Prohibition Except as provided in subsections (b) and (c), none of the funds authorized to be appropriated by this Act or otherwise made available for fiscal year 2024 for the Air Force may be obligated or expended to retire, prepare to retire, or place in storage or in backup aircraft inventory any E–3 aircraft if such actions would reduce the total aircraft inventory of such aircraft below 16. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H757ECB93781540FA8AA46E3930697FE6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Exception for plan Effective date.

The limitation under subsection (a) shall not apply to individual F–16C/D aircraft that the Secretary of the Air Force determines, on a case-by-case basis, to be no longer mission capable and uneconomical to repair because of aircraft accidents, mishaps, or excessive material degradation and non-airworthiness status of certain aircraft. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1DA59BB6176A4EB6B813179AC4B0B746" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Information to Congress For each F–16C/D aircraft that the Secretary of the Air Force proposes to retire in a fiscal year, the Secretary shall include, in the materials submitted by the Secretary in support of the budget of the President for that 137 STAT. 177 fiscal year (as submitted to Congress under section 1105(a) of title 31, United States Code), a description of— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDFA4D12FBD6E46B5A5677D7B70ECA5FB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) each upgrade and modification made to such aircraft, including— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC1610D54233E45F1AAE9AE9F2DD8E905" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the date of the upgrade or modification; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA5B24638B2F649E7AA49B170FA71407A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the cost of such upgrade or modification in current year dollars; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H33A4CEE857634669A52D66B1097031B2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the estimated remaining service-life (expressed as equivalent flight hours and years) of— Estimate.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC1B311C9C0634C37AF6B63DBA83D4C87" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Any plans of the Secretary to augment or supplant existing piloted tactical fighter aircraft capability or capacity with Collaborative Combat Aircraft Increment 1 or Increment 2 capability or capacity. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5DBE4B86AD9746AB8EEB9A9637B0E1DF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) Any plans of the Secretary to augment or supplant existing piloted tactical fighter aircraft training events via acquisition and fielding of common, joint, all-domain, high-fidelity synthetic simulation environments. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H02F9A825BE2045BAA561539F9F50CD92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report Not later than April 1, 2024, the Secretary of the Air Force shall submit to the congressional defense committees a report that includes the plan developed under subsection (a 137 STAT.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5EDDB9544307476EB161C7961DAFE26D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) A breakdown of any additional authorities needed to move directly to the LOGCAP VI contract instead of recompeting the task orders described in subsection (a). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF3EF26D261D74C0AA73D08DC8D03E746" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of the Army shall submit to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and the House of Representatives a report on the results of the review conducted under subsection (a), including the results of the review with respect to each element specified in subsection (b). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAB1CBE15E5BE4A81AEDDD33CC6900647" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Definitions In this section: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAD95566EBE52432499E688E2D3F9073E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">LOGCAP V contract means the contract for the logistics augmentation program of the Army that is due to expire in 2028.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAB1CBE15E5BE4A81AEDDD33CC6900647" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Definitions In this section: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAD95566EBE52432499E688E2D3F9073E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">LOGCAP V contract means the contract for the logistics augmentation program of the Army that is due to expire in 2028. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCECE06A9272345A2AAEC096412B3CD01" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">LOGCAP VI contract means a successor contract for the logistics augmentation program of the Army that is expected to be entered into following the expiration of the LOGCAP V contract. <subtitle id="H0ADBD3ABDB9C49E182E4A2C3A3681BA9" qb-display-quote="yes" style="OLC"> C Navy Programs <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H440B3F6A466E4B81B6A35113434704D2" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 121.

MODIFICATION OF REQUIREMENTS FOR MINIMUM NUMBER OF CARRIER AIR WINGS OF THE NAVY <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H78A8F8BED54F4038A3BB310271591F94" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Modification of requirements <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4E9C95B41FB94350A39DDBFAE483030B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Subsection (e) of section 8062 of title 10, United States Code, is amended to read as follows— <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HE9E147071C744211A3AA724DBC91FF86" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF788454C1A954E6CA2B6445B4E9A8054" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) The Secretary of the Navy shall ensure that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H32A02494D72B4618B456B21752442996" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the Navy maintains a minimum of 9 carrier air wings; and Definitions. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H54FFC599A5344470B53A3621C2762D90" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) for each such carrier air wing, the Navy maintains a dedicated and fully staffed headquarters. .

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAE72088958C44020876AFEE4D9793052" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Exception Certification. The Secretary of Defense may reduce the number of aircraft upgraded under subsection (a) below 24 if the Secretary certifies to the congressional defense committees that such reduction is in the interests of national security. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7871D59C59AA40E1BCFE597ED1CABCA0" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 126.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD3AAFEFFA16042B38F57B2ADC1266B45" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 132. LIMITATIONS AND MINIMUM INVENTORY REQUIREMENT RELATING TO RQ–4 AIRCRAFT Section 9062 of title 10, United States Code, as amended by section 131, is further amended by adding at the end the following new subsection: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HD4597476F48E46139EFDF301BECB9083" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H86E8D3B4E10E4292A8C0E6E28EF63571" qb-display-quote="yes"> (m) <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H22C0C6A14A274A28A8F7BA6D28475F35" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) During the period beginning on the date of the enactment of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2024 and ending on September 30, 2028, the Secretary of the Air Force may not— Time period. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEA92FC4BE6CD4507809A45DB1F14CA40" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) retire an RQ–4 aircraft; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4ECA54C610994E83BA979BF2349C0532" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) reduce funding for unit personnel or weapon system sustainment activities for RQ–4 aircraft in a manner that presumes future congressional authority to divest such aircraft; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBDD7D82320A849B3A5012036FFD0B0E5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) keep an RQ–4 aircraft in a status considered excess to the requirements of the possessing command and awaiting disposition instructions (commonly referred to as <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">XJ status); or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H23E53E0EFADF4C32867945FBC277765D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) decrease the total aircraft inventory of RQ–4 aircraft below 10 aircraft.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB2214A22062049F59AE6B1B154B83DBD" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 141. LIMITATION ON ISSUANCE OF ACQUISITION STRATEGY FOR THE KC–135 RECAPITALIZATION PROGRAM The Secretary of the Air Force may not issue an acquisition strategy for the KC–135 recapitalization program until the date on which the Secretary submits to the congressional defense committees the following documentation: 137 STAT. 176 <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H93E46E5854444F24B36C67C1D8EC68F3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) An updated tanker roadmap timeline to include procurement of the Next Generation Air Refueling System.

The limitation under subsection (a) shall not apply to individual F–16C/D aircraft that the Secretary of the Air Force determines, on a case-by-case basis, to be no longer mission capable and uneconomical to repair because of aircraft accidents, mishaps, or excessive material degradation and non-airworthiness status of certain aircraft. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1DA59BB6176A4EB6B813179AC4B0B746" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Information to Congress For each F–16C/D aircraft that the Secretary of the Air Force proposes to retire in a fiscal year, the Secretary shall include, in the materials submitted by the Secretary in support of the budget of the President for that 137 STAT. 177 fiscal year (as submitted to Congress under section 1105(a) of title 31, United States Code), a description of— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDFA4D12FBD6E46B5A5677D7B70ECA5FB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) each upgrade and modification made to such aircraft, including— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC1610D54233E45F1AAE9AE9F2DD8E905" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the date of the upgrade or modification; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA5B24638B2F649E7AA49B170FA71407A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the cost of such upgrade or modification in current year dollars; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H33A4CEE857634669A52D66B1097031B2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the estimated remaining service-life (expressed as equivalent flight hours and years) of— Estimate.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5DBE4B86AD9746AB8EEB9A9637B0E1DF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) Any plans of the Secretary to augment or supplant existing piloted tactical fighter aircraft training events via acquisition and fielding of common, joint, all-domain, high-fidelity synthetic simulation environments. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H02F9A825BE2045BAA561539F9F50CD92" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report Not later than April 1, 2024, the Secretary of the Air Force shall submit to the congressional defense committees a report that includes the plan developed under subsection (a 137 STAT. 179 ).

3201. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCD0526DD353249DB9824D275D7207DEB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Prohibition The Secretary of Defense may not include in a solicitation for a tactical tracked vehicle or tactical wheeled vehicle a requirement that such vehicle use proprietary armor. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB00DD9E19F654AF6AB5141BE12C6E4F4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Applicability Subsection (a) shall not apply to a contract for the procurement of a tactical tracked vehicle or tactical wheeled vehicle entered into before the date of the enactment of this Act.

PLAN FOR LONG-TERM AIR FORCE FIGHTER FORCE STRUCTURE 10 USC 148. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4F8BE3CDDBAB4C37B59F2FEEB43EE4B5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Plan required The Secretary of the Air Force, in consultation with the Director of the Air National Guard and the Commander of the Air Force Reserve, shall develop a long-term tactical fighter force structure, recapitalization, training, and sustainment plan for the active and reserve components of the Air Force. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7BCCBD72F62042D6A5F6824B39324D90" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Elements The plan under subsection (a) shall address each of the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBAA5C43249E647DF9BB6DC4F54609E64" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) The appropriate mix of tactical fighter aircraft force structure, with accompanying operational risk analyses, required for the Secretary of the Air Force to meet expected steady-state, global force management allocation plans and geographical combatant commander contingency operational plans tasked to the Air Force using active and reserve component units.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF3EF26D261D74C0AA73D08DC8D03E746" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of the Army shall submit to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and the House of Representatives a report on the results of the review conducted under subsection (a), including the results of the review with respect to each element specified in subsection (b). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAB1CBE15E5BE4A81AEDDD33CC6900647" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Definitions In this section: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAD95566EBE52432499E688E2D3F9073E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">LOGCAP V contract means the contract for the logistics augmentation program of the Army that is due to expire in 2028. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCECE06A9272345A2AAEC096412B3CD01" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">LOGCAP VI contract means a successor contract for the logistics augmentation program of the Army that is expected to be entered into following the expiration of the LOGCAP V contract.

<subtitle id="H0ADBD3ABDB9C49E182E4A2C3A3681BA9" qb-display-quote="yes" style="OLC"> C Navy Programs <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H440B3F6A466E4B81B6A35113434704D2" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 121. MODIFICATION OF REQUIREMENTS FOR MINIMUM NUMBER OF CARRIER AIR WINGS OF THE NAVY <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H78A8F8BED54F4038A3BB310271591F94" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Modification of requirements <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4E9C95B41FB94350A39DDBFAE483030B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Subsection (e) of section 8062 of title 10, United States Code, is amended to read as follows— <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HE9E147071C744211A3AA724DBC91FF86" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF788454C1A954E6CA2B6445B4E9A8054" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) The Secretary of the Navy shall ensure that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H32A02494D72B4618B456B21752442996" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the Navy maintains a minimum of 9 carrier air wings; and Definitions. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H54FFC599A5344470B53A3621C2762D90" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) for each such carrier air wing, the Navy maintains a dedicated and fully staffed headquarters.

The Secretary of the Navy shall conduct an analysis of potential approaches to the manning, operation, and deployment of a 10th aircraft carrier and associated carrier air wing to determine how the Navy can mobilize such a carrier and air wing if required by operational needs. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6499F5C58B6943A2AD3A2E97609B2C3B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Elements The analysis under paragraph (1) shall address the following: <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2AF584A0C6424B05918D26D1761311C3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) The timeline associated with removing an aircraft carrier from each the following maintenance availability types: Timeline. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFDED8B00B5DB4267B509945B683EBA2B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) Complex Overhaul.

170 fiscal year 2024, for advance procurement associated with the Virginia class submarines for which authorization to enter into a multiyear procurement contract is provided under subsection (a) and for equipment or subsystems associated with the Virginia class submarine program, including procurement of— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H35C40D94D37344FC95651D228499238B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) long lead time material; or <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6F1CC0B07B624ACE8810597A682BA6F1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) material or equipment in economic order quantities when cost savings are achievable. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9D2D23744F2E476FABACFB61AAAECB42" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Condition for out-year contract payments A contract entered into under subsection (a) shall provide that any obligation of the United States to make a payment under the contract for a fiscal year after fiscal year 2025 is subject to the availability of appropriations or funds for that purpose for such later fiscal year. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF0AC0F60ED8244BA9534E0AD9DD51268" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Limitation on termination liability A contract for the construction of Virginia class submarines entered into under subsection (a) shall include a clause that limits the liability of the United States to the contractor for any termination of the contract.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD7A0C68467EE4F61A67DB334F214ED87" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Liability Any contract entered into under subsection (a) shall provide that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBBB7F5DFD4814DF8ADFCF58B04CD8156" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) any obligation of the United States to make a payment under the contract is subject to the availability of appropriations for that purpose; and Payments. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H650CB63E652942EFB7105E5662DA18F1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the total liability of the Federal Government for termination of the contract shall be limited to the total amount of funding obligated to the contract at the time of termination. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H62211E073C6245C7AD857E0B04FC4D15" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 125.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H84C4DA487B404DF7A4A7FEC00D2F3A87" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 127. ANNUAL REPORTS ON USE OF GOVERNMENT DOCKS FOR SHIP REPAIR AND MAINTENANCE Not later than June 30, 2024, and on an annual basis thereafter through 2028, the Secretary of the Navy shall submit to the congressional defense committees a report that— Time period. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDD3A8CF5C1EE4317BD9B114A2A7EE603" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) identifies each instance in the year preceding the date of the report in which the Navy used a Government dock for a ship repair and maintenance availability when sufficient capacity was available in private docks during the period in which such repairs and maintenance were expected to be performed; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF2868CE9C84E48929D5D6506B3D56CD7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) for each such instance, provides an explanation of the reasons the Navy used a Government dock rather than a private dock.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC2871C1B2EA74DAF8FD5A0CB8BFE0867" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 122. EXTENSION OF PROHIBITION ON AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS FOR NAVY PORT WATERBORNE SECURITY BARRIERS Section 130(a) of the John S. McCain National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2019 (Public Law 115–232; 132 Stat. 1665), as most recently amended by section 123(a) of the James M. Inhofe National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2023 (Public Law 117–263; 136 Stat.

170 fiscal year 2024, for advance procurement associated with the Virginia class submarines for which authorization to enter into a multiyear procurement contract is provided under subsection (a) and for equipment or subsystems associated with the Virginia class submarine program, including procurement of— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H35C40D94D37344FC95651D228499238B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) long lead time material; or <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6F1CC0B07B624ACE8810597A682BA6F1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) material or equipment in economic order quantities when cost savings are achievable. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9D2D23744F2E476FABACFB61AAAECB42" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Condition for out-year contract payments A contract entered into under subsection (a) shall provide that any obligation of the United States to make a payment under the contract for a fiscal year after fiscal year 2025 is subject to the availability of appropriations or funds for that purpose for such later fiscal year. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF0AC0F60ED8244BA9534E0AD9DD51268" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Limitation on termination liability A contract for the construction of Virginia class submarines entered into under subsection (a) shall include a clause that limits the liability of the United States to the contractor for any termination of the contract.

The maximum liability of the United States under the clause shall be the amount appropriated for the submarines covered by the contract regardless of the amount obligated under the contract. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC6C812521B0448858AC62C098889C552" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Virginia class submarine defined The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Virginia class submarine means a block VI configured Virginia class submarine. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE575D1964AB3416EBA2E1BC4FF6F62B1" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 124.

Beginning in fiscal year 2024, the Secretary of the Navy may enter into one or more contracts for the procurement of up to six Auxiliary Personnel Lighter class vessels and associated material. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD7A0C68467EE4F61A67DB334F214ED87" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Liability Any contract entered into under subsection (a) shall provide that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBBB7F5DFD4814DF8ADFCF58B04CD8156" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) any obligation of the United States to make a payment under the contract is subject to the availability of appropriations for that purpose; and Payments. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H650CB63E652942EFB7105E5662DA18F1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the total liability of the Federal Government for termination of the contract shall be limited to the total amount of funding obligated to the contract at the time of termination.

2801. <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H1BFD6476D3934B99BB8DDB611D840214" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H195B73CD732643DEA04E6AE41C53F1B4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (l) <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9E2DAE6C59734705A03D656090D62338" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) During the period beginning on the date of the enactment of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2024 137 STAT. 300 and ending on September 30, 2029, the Secretary of the Air Force may not— Time period.

300 and ending on September 30, 2029, the Secretary of the Air Force may not— Time period. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF6CF2F452D904D358E843E251DE3EE8A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) retire more than 68 F–15E aircraft; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAF28E10B295240EBBBFD75C68065F848" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) reduce funding for unit personnel or weapon system sustainment activities for retained F–15E aircraft in a manner that presumes future congressional authority to divest such aircraft; or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5220C916300844AC8904A5807E9AA6C0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) keep an F–15E aircraft (other than an aircraft identified for retirement under subparagraph (A)) in a status considered excess to the requirements of the possessing command and awaiting disposition instructions (commonly referred to as <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">XJ status). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H91AD4B5190B044AD9E3FF7122F1D5B4F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) The prohibition under paragraph (1) shall not apply to individual F–15E aircraft that the Secretary of the Air Force determines, on a case-by-case basis, to be no longer mission capable and uneconomical to repair because of aircraft accidents, mishaps, or excessive material degradation and non-airworthiness status of certain aircraft.

. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA5B933D3EA6347719870DDB5ED72944A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Clarification of relationship between limitations The authority of the Secretary of the Air Force to retire F–15E aircraft to the extent allowed under subsection (l)(1)(A) of section 9062 of title 10, United States Code (as added by subsection (a) of this section) shall not apply until the Secretary complies with the requirements of section 150 of the James M. Inhofe National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2023 (Public Law 117–263; 136 Stat. 2456) (as amended by subsection (b) of this section).

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD3AAFEFFA16042B38F57B2ADC1266B45" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 132. LIMITATIONS AND MINIMUM INVENTORY REQUIREMENT RELATING TO RQ–4 AIRCRAFT Section 9062 of title 10, United States Code, as amended by section 131, is further amended by adding at the end the following new subsection: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HD4597476F48E46139EFDF301BECB9083" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H86E8D3B4E10E4292A8C0E6E28EF63571" qb-display-quote="yes"> (m) <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H22C0C6A14A274A28A8F7BA6D28475F35" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) During the period beginning on the date of the enactment of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2024 and ending on September 30, 2028, the Secretary of the Air Force may not— Time period. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEA92FC4BE6CD4507809A45DB1F14CA40" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) retire an RQ–4 aircraft; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4ECA54C610994E83BA979BF2349C0532" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) reduce funding for unit personnel or weapon system sustainment activities for RQ–4 aircraft in a manner that presumes future congressional authority to divest such aircraft; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBDD7D82320A849B3A5012036FFD0B0E5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) keep an RQ–4 aircraft in a status considered excess to the requirements of the possessing command and awaiting disposition instructions (commonly referred to as <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">XJ status); or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H23E53E0EFADF4C32867945FBC277765D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) decrease the total aircraft inventory of RQ–4 aircraft below 10 aircraft.

MODIFICATION TO PROHIBITION ON CERTAIN REDUCTIONS TO B–1 BOMBER AIRCRAFT SQUADRONS Section 133 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2022 (Public Law 117–81; 135 Stat. 1574) is amended— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4F8BE4C9A5AA4041B8125E99B7EB7300" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) by amending subsection (b) to read as follows: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HCCC6751CB5D347629E7CAB537478E93F" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H10C87114AD614F8988810EF03853EF50" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Exceptions The prohibition under subsection (a) shall not apply— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H26A68481074342DC9CF32714A3E6A73B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) to a bomb wing for which the Secretary of the Air Force has commenced the process of replacing B–1 bomber aircraft with B–21 bomber aircraft; or <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H98CECE0DA2504DA2964B13B4B86A4180" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) so as to prohibit the retirement of the individual B–1 aircraft designated 85–0089, which has been determined by Secretary of the Air Force to be no longer mission capable and uneconomical to repair due to damage sustained on April 20, 2022. Determination.

Inhofe National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2023 (Public Law 117–263; 136 Stat.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H762E000744DB4A869F31CBBFBB83E5BC" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 139. PROHIBITION ON AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS FOR RETIREMENT OF KC–135 AIRCRAFT <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC1B636916B1B44B5909232E1436C831C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Prohibition Except as provided in subsection (b), none of the funds authorized to be appropriated by this Act or otherwise made available for fiscal year 2024 for the Air Force may be obligated or expended to retire, or prepare to retire, a KC–135 aircraft. Study.

Study. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0B6AEFAAE56E46D390A6346994BF5C62" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Exception The prohibition under subsection (a) shall not apply to individual KC–135 aircraft that the Secretary of the Air Force determines, on a case-by-case basis, to be no longer mission capable and uneconomical to repair because of aircraft accidents, mishaps, or excessive material degradation and non-airworthiness status of certain aircraft. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA5503D4270FB44E6A9B00BFB36780747" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 140.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7047BE6E89FF438FAF154FE30352F276" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 143. PROHIBITION ON AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS FOR TERMINATION OF PRODUCTION LINES FOR THE HH–60W AIRCRAFT None of the funds authorized to be appropriated by this Act or otherwise made available for fiscal year 2024 for the Air Force may be obligated or expended to terminate the operations of, or to prepare to terminate the operations of, a production line for HH–60W Combat Rescue Helicopters. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBAC6BD852BE848B28A12DC7CF7354377" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 144.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBAC6BD852BE848B28A12DC7CF7354377" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 144. LIMITATION ON RETIREMENT OF F–16C/D AIRCRAFT <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCC1676ACD2B74ADCB75DB570BC46E90E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Limitation Effective date. Time period.

The limitation under subsection (a) shall not apply to individual F–16C/D aircraft that the Secretary of the Air Force determines, on a case-by-case basis, to be no longer mission capable and uneconomical to repair because of aircraft accidents, mishaps, or excessive material degradation and non-airworthiness status of certain aircraft. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1DA59BB6176A4EB6B813179AC4B0B746" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Information to Congress For each F–16C/D aircraft that the Secretary of the Air Force proposes to retire in a fiscal year, the Secretary shall include, in the materials submitted by the Secretary in support of the budget of the President for that 137 STAT. 177 fiscal year (as submitted to Congress under section 1105(a) of title 31, United States Code), a description of— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDFA4D12FBD6E46B5A5677D7B70ECA5FB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) each upgrade and modification made to such aircraft, including— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC1610D54233E45F1AAE9AE9F2DD8E905" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the date of the upgrade or modification; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA5B24638B2F649E7AA49B170FA71407A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the cost of such upgrade or modification in current year dollars; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H33A4CEE857634669A52D66B1097031B2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the estimated remaining service-life (expressed as equivalent flight hours and years) of— Estimate.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1DA59BB6176A4EB6B813179AC4B0B746" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Information to Congress For each F–16C/D aircraft that the Secretary of the Air Force proposes to retire in a fiscal year, the Secretary shall include, in the materials submitted by the Secretary in support of the budget of the President for that 137 STAT. 177 fiscal year (as submitted to Congress under section 1105(a) of title 31, United States Code), a description of— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDFA4D12FBD6E46B5A5677D7B70ECA5FB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) each upgrade and modification made to such aircraft, including— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC1610D54233E45F1AAE9AE9F2DD8E905" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the date of the upgrade or modification; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA5B24638B2F649E7AA49B170FA71407A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the cost of such upgrade or modification in current year dollars; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H33A4CEE857634669A52D66B1097031B2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the estimated remaining service-life (expressed as equivalent flight hours and years) of— Estimate. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H26222D49418F4E77AD93B83330420B89" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the aircraft; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD6661020546A410AB7A8B3B1B681DF3B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the onboard systems of the aircraft.

Cost estimates. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H03127EEBE7054580B5D003B61615AF54" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Covered contract defined In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">covered contract means the contract for the procurement of KC–46A aircraft entered into between the Department of the Air Force and the Boeing Company that is in effect as of the date of the enactment of this Act. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8CF96058CFE7410E8B50C4A7BD195DC4" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 146.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4F8BE3CDDBAB4C37B59F2FEEB43EE4B5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Plan required The Secretary of the Air Force, in consultation with the Director of the Air National Guard and the Commander of the Air Force Reserve, shall develop a long-term tactical fighter force structure, recapitalization, training, and sustainment plan for the active and reserve components of the Air Force. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7BCCBD72F62042D6A5F6824B39324D90" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Elements The plan under subsection (a) shall address each of the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBAA5C43249E647DF9BB6DC4F54609E64" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) The appropriate mix of tactical fighter aircraft force structure, with accompanying operational risk analyses, required for the Secretary of the Air Force to meet expected steady-state, global force management allocation plans and geographical combatant commander contingency operational plans tasked to the Air Force using active and reserve component units. Analyses.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEE177C29DF0F4A09A60A3810E540B02F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) For each proposed divestment, re-prioritization, or retirement, an explanation of— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H108F28E56A3C4EE8B0FF1A6AA324698A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the timeline for the divestment, re-prioritization, or retirement, including any factors that may affect such timelines positively or negatively; Timeline. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA7798163C738486681E0C2D1B7C38CAE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) any cost savings associated with the divestment, re-prioritization, or retirement; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6EC9C7B70CA44FB9A83F14E701A4F77D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) the rationale for the divestment, re-prioritization, or retirement, including a qualitative description of the risk associated with the divestment, re-prioritization, or retirement based on the most recent National Defense Strategy (as of the date of the report); <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1506D298B75F4C1988A03F2933D4DB11" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) any critical dependencies with other program efforts that might affect the timeline for such divestment, reprioritization, or retirement; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7FB14DF6ED034E3C89195995F4B67C5F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) the expected disposition of the weapon system after divestment, re-prioritization or retirement; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC8A4A7DE3E9248339D16C76EEBF78094" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) identification of the system or systems that are expected to satisfy the military requirements that were fulfilled by the weapon system once the divestment, re-prioritization, or retirement of that weapon system is completed. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3B096BBBF3494B73BCAA7E5B1C278F0A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Relationship to other reports The Secretary of Defense shall ensure that the report required under subsection (a) is deconflicted with the report required under section 222e of this title.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEE177C29DF0F4A09A60A3810E540B02F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) For each proposed divestment, re-prioritization, or retirement, an explanation of— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H108F28E56A3C4EE8B0FF1A6AA324698A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the timeline for the divestment, re-prioritization, or retirement, including any factors that may affect such timelines positively or negatively; <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4B97D85B555744889FC0254CE41580BB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Condition for out-year contract payments A contract entered into under subsection (a) shall provide that any obligation of the United States to make a payment under the contract for a fiscal year after fiscal year 2024 is subject to the availability of appropriations or funds for that purpose for such later fiscal year. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC9662D25CC794DC0A980526686ABDDDE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Definitions In this section: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFB00AB8A331249D2AA818D19107F3B4B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">critical mineral means a mineral determined to be a strategic and critical material under section 3(a) of the Strategic and Critical Materials Stock Piling Act (50 U.S.C. 98b(a)).

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H20AD1D7679924DC59BFD1E9EE7F7EAED" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) Gotion High tech Company, Limited. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H04F9D09F26DB4F6CB52FA3BD24F5B66B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) Hithium Energy Storage Technology company, Limited. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA2CF1DEB48DB483CBEC1071C83CF92F2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) Any successor to an entity specified in paragraphs (1) through (6).

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H04F9D09F26DB4F6CB52FA3BD24F5B66B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) Hithium Energy Storage Technology company, Limited. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA2CF1DEB48DB483CBEC1071C83CF92F2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) Any successor to an entity specified in paragraphs (1) through (6). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF1169B32BFAC4DC694CA4A2605BFE10A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Treatment of production For purposes of this section, a battery shall be treated as produced by an entity specified in subsection (b) if that entity— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2AE8C724046E430D8FB18849FF02C8FE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) assembles or manufactures the final product; or <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF9F5B87CF34A447D9EC47C4D817E45E6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) creates or otherwise provides a majority of the components used in the battery.

In the budget justification materials submitted in support of the budget of the Department of Defense (as submitted with the budget of the President under section 1105(a) of title 31, United States Code) for each of fiscal years 2025, 2030, and 2035, the Secretary of the Army shall include a report on the strategy of the Army for tactical wheeled vehicles. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDD470F6ED8064327AF167A5ADB18F542" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Requirements for strategy Each strategy required by subsection (a) shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8BBD896CACD64EFCA854CE1B3A7B876D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) align with the applicable national defense strategy under section 113(g) of title 10, United States Code, and applicable policies; 10 USC prec.

Time period. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0548E407485F4F6B89E9B16FC47A85D0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) A description of the necessary force structure and capabilities of tactical wheeled vehicles to meet the requirements of the national security strategy described in subsection (b)(2). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFD0A5A72D3F34FBCB76F0D2B1AEC4710" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) The estimated levels of annual funding, by vehicle class, in both graphical and tabular form, necessary to carry out the program described in paragraph (1), together with a discussion of the procurement strategies on which such estimated levels of annual funding are based.
