Not later than 15 days after each budget submission described in subsection (a), in conjunction with the submission of each strategy required by such subsection, the Secretary of the Army shall provide to the congressional defense committees a briefing that addresses the investment needed for each platform of tactical wheeled vehicle of the Army across the period covered by the most recent future-years defense program submitted to Congress under section 221 of title 10, United States Code (as of the date of the briefing). <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H67949AE13A4F488FBDB7AE42FA0837A9" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 113.

The Secretary of the Army, in consultation with the Secretary of Defense and the commanders of the geographic combatant commands, shall conduct a review of the proposed recompete of the operational task orders of the geographic combatant commands under the LOGCAP V contract. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H85D3E02BE39A4EEDA29C82815238BB7A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Elements The review required by subsection (a) shall include the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H74DB6A1CD871498A96677DDE57FEA9A2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) A business case analysis of the cost and operational benefit of recompeting the task orders described in subsection (a). Analysis.

10 USC 3702. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBFB4753D90BE4EA08A20CD47B024270D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the quality and timing of the work performed under the task orders described in such subsection; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD6BFBAB575C84847863BFFB0C266F4F6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the ability of the Army to transition to the LOGCAP VI contract, including any effects on the quality and timing of such transition. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD13151924ED042228A130BBF2F8D58AA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) An analysis of recompeting the task orders described in subsection (a) compared to transitioning directly to the LOGCAP VI contract instead of recompeting such task orders.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF3EF26D261D74C0AA73D08DC8D03E746" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Report Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of the Army shall submit to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and the House of Representatives a report on the results of the review conducted under subsection (a), including the results of the review with respect to each element specified in subsection (b). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAB1CBE15E5BE4A81AEDDD33CC6900647" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Definitions In this section: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAD95566EBE52432499E688E2D3F9073E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">LOGCAP V contract means the contract for the logistics augmentation program of the Army that is due to expire in 2028. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCECE06A9272345A2AAEC096412B3CD01" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">LOGCAP VI contract means a successor contract for the logistics augmentation program of the Army that is expected to be entered into following the expiration of the LOGCAP V contract.

LIMITATION ON CONSIDERATION OF GOVERNMENT-OPERATED DRY DOCKS IN CERTAIN CONTRACT SOLICITATIONS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCC591F1E8348451F90B3C651718851BB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general California. With respect to a solicitation of the Secretary of the Navy for the award of a contract for private sector non-nuclear surface ship maintenance in San Diego, California, the 137 STAT. 171 Secretary shall ensure, in accordance with section 2466 of title 10, United States Code, that Government-operated dry docks are only included in such solicitation if there is insufficient capacity at privately-operated dry docks for performance of such contract.

With respect to a solicitation of the Secretary of the Navy for the award of a contract for private sector non-nuclear surface ship maintenance in San Diego, California, the 137 STAT. 171 Secretary shall ensure, in accordance with section 2466 of title 10, United States Code, that Government-operated dry docks are only included in such solicitation if there is insufficient capacity at privately-operated dry docks for performance of such contract. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H725367D382424A7391D0E4328CC9E0AE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Applicability and termination The prohibition under subsection (a) shall apply with respect to solicitations for contracts issued after the date of the enactment of this Act and shall terminate on the date that is five years after such date of enactment.

Not later than October 1, 2024, and not later than October 1 of each year thereafter through 2029, the Secretary of the Air Force shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCAF5413FDBEE42FDB31D688909874739" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) update the report required under subsection (b); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H57D3FED104FA486EA04D38BED6C6142F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) submit the updated report to the congressional defense committees. .

. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA5B933D3EA6347719870DDB5ED72944A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Clarification of relationship between limitations The authority of the Secretary of the Air Force to retire F–15E aircraft to the extent allowed under subsection (l)(1)(A) of section 9062 of title 10, United States Code (as added by subsection (a) of this section) shall not apply until the Secretary complies with the requirements of section 150 of the James M. Inhofe National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2023 (Public Law 117–263; 136 Stat. 2456) (as amended by subsection (b) of this section).
